Long active in traditional women's commercial activities (such as inter-village trade in cloth, robes and dresses), the Dieuf Diarignou group plans to invest in an innovative business opportunity: the preparation and sale of Cafe Touba.  Cafe Touba is a traditional drink particular to Senegal, in which roasted coffee beans are brewed with whole cloves.  The loan will allow the group to purchase the utensils, stoves and sachets needed to prepare the dry Cafe Touba mix and package it for retail sale in the markets of nearby towns as well as throughout their own village.  This will help to create jobs and allow the women to participate more actively in the economic life of their country, and the extra income will provide more working capital for their clothing sales business.



Longtemps axé dans le petit commerce (commerce de tissus, robes, pagnes), le groupement Dieuf Diarignou 1 innove avec la  fabrication du café touba (une spécialité bien sénégalaise faite à base de café mélangé à des haricots torréfiés et des clous de girofle) et de sa commercialisation. Le prêt va leur permettre d'acheter des matières premières (ustensiles, fours, sachets ) pour pouvoir transformer le café, le mettre dans des sachets et le vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires et même encore dans les points les plus reculés du village afin de créer des emplois et d'activer fortement la participation effective des femmes à la vie économique de leur pays, mais aussi d'augmenter les revenus des membres par le profit tiré de la fabrication du café et redynamiser ses activités liées au textile.

loans.use: Preparation and sale of Cafe Touba coffee mix

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Despite his age, 66 year old Gerardo G. Nunez is full of energy and works as hard as if he were a young boy. He is married to Asuncion Rivarola (64) and they have three sons, each of whom is married and living with their own families.

Gerardo used to make leather shoes and sell them to farm workers. He still has a workshop where he designs and makes leather products. With the earnings generated by this business, Gerardo opened a clothes shop for his wife. Since 2006, his wife Asuncion has sold old clothes and shoes to a wide number of costumers. Since then the business has grown more and more every day.

They are requesting a Kiva loan to buy clothes and shoes for this winter season.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes for the winter.

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.en:
Six months ago, the committee “Santo domingo” was formed. Some of the original founding members still belong to the committee and they are now very proud to be in the second cycle. The group receives financial assistance and has saved 750.800 guaranies so far.

The ladies of the committee are involved in different type of business such as running grocery stores, sales of clothing, chicken, fruits, honey, bijouterie (trinkets and ornaments) and lingerie among others. The money provided by this Kiva loan will be used to purchase merchandise in some members' cases and raw materials in others.

These ladies have one important thing in common: they all want to bring benefits to their families by working very hard and generating income. They all want to give their sons the opportunity to go to school or college.

loans.use:
To buy

(i) ingredients to cook traditional Paraguayan meals

(ii) fruits such as oranges, bananas, pineapples, apples, pears

(iii) cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina Rios Chavez is a mother of 6 children, 4 of whom are already married and do not live with her. The rest are school-going children who live with her mother. The father of the six children left Cristina many years ago, so she is the only one generating income in the house.

She owns a grocery store/mini restaurant, where she sells drinks and food. According to Cristina, business is most brisk in the evening and at night. As a result, she spends mornings preparing food and organizing everything. Cristina works everyday without a break.

The money provided by this loan will be used to purchase items such as meat, flour, vegetables and drinks.

loans.use: To purchase items such as meat, flour, vegetables and drinks.

loans.name: Comite Kuña Guapa Group

texts.en:
The committee was formed in July 2006. Gladys Teresa M. Lopez initiated the first meeting and convinced 14 other ladies to work together to form the group in order to have access to capital. Excited about the idea, the ladies decided to form a committee in order to bring prosperity to their families.

Among the businesses the ladies run are: grocery stores, candy stores, tailoring shops, sales of detergents, soaps, food drinks, clothes and lingerie among others. The money provided by this Kiva loan will be used to purchase clothing, lingerie, food ingredients such as flour, eggs and butter and drinks such as beers, Coke, wines and juices.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: The money provided by this Kiva loan will be used to purchase clothing, lingerie, food ingredients such as flour, eggs and butter and drinks such as beers, Coke, wines and juices.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo G. is married and has two school-going sons. Gustavo owns two clothing stores in a well-known market in Asunción called “Mercado 4”. The stores are located in a strategic place in the centre of the market. This location attracts many clients. Gustavo dreams of expanding his stores in order to satisfy his clients and to offer a better atmosphere to his employers.

Gustavo wants to repair his house in order to rent out some rooms and thus have another source of income. The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement, lime, sand, stones, bricks and paint so he can make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, lime, sand, stones, bricks and paint.

loans.name: Comité San Rafael Group

texts.en:
This Comite San Rafael group of women was formed in October 2006. Maria Teresa Franco and Juliana V. initiated the first meeting and convinced 16 ladies to work together to form the group in order to have access to capital. Excited about the idea, the ladies decided to form a committee in order to bring prosperity to their families.

The ladies are involved in many business activities such as: running grocery stores and selling fruit, clothes, bags, shoes, drinks and sheets among others. The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase these goods.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to reach success.

loans.use: The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase fruits, clothes, bags, shoes, drinks and sheets.

loans.name: Comite Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to reach success.

Yolanda A. contacted her friends and neighbors and told them about the committee. She shared with these women her desire of changing their world for the better by working very hard. Yolanda’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

The members of the commitee are involved in many different business activities such as the sales of cosmetics, food, gift wraps, cloths, jewellery, cleaning products and drinks.

The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase

1. Food ingredients such as meat, chicken, ham, cheese, bread, eggs, vegetables, pastas, etc;

2. Drinks such as Coke, beers, wine, soft drinks; and

3. Clothes such as T-shirts, socks, pants and shoes

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients such as meat, chicken, ham, cheese, bread, eggs, vegetables, pastas, etc; drinks such as Coke, beers, wine, soft drinks; clothes such as t-shirts, socks, pants and shoes.

loans.name: María Cristina's Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee is now very proud to be in their fourth loan cycle with 17 members. They all get along very well, pay punctually and receive the required assistance in their meetings.

Among the businesses these ladies run are: grocery stores, production of cleaning products, sales of clothing, food, drinks, bijouterie (trinkets and ornaments) and lingerie. For instance, Lizza and Carolina P. make products such as deodorants and detergents and then sell them to residents of the neighborhood.

The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase lingerie, drinks, food and raw materials to make cleaning products and clothing among others.

loans.use: The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase lingerie, drinks, food and raw materials to make cleaning products and clothing among others.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María has worked raising animals for the last 8 years with the desire to improve her household’s economic situation following various losses in agricultural investments. For this reason she has decided install a small space in her home to be a stable for her dear calves. Thanks to her efforts she has obtained notable changes in her household and wishes to continue improving with much hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

María, se dedica a la crianza de vacas hace 8 años con el deseo de mejorar la economía de su hogar tras varias pérdidas de inversión agrícola. Por esa razón decidió implementar un pequeño espacio de su hogar a manera de establo y acoger a sus queridas vaquitas, gracias a su empeño ha obtenido notables cambios en su hogar y esta deseosa de seguir mejorando con mucha dedicación.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
The business of the sale of empanadas and beautiful woven clothing bring solace to Celia and her adorable children, for whom she works hard and wishes to offer them the necessary tools so they can achieve success in the future. Celia works every day of the week in her business selling delicious empanadas and while she offers her appetizing snack she loses no time weaving with her agile and talented hands beautiful hats, shawls and gloves which she sells wholesale in the Leguna Temporal market of the city of Juliaca. Thanks to her perseverance and dedication since she became both father and mother of her 4 dear children she has the satisfaction of offering them stability and above all education.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de venta de salteñas y bellos tejidos de prendas de vestir le viene generando tranquilidad a doña Celia y a sus adorables hijos, por quienes se esfuerza y desea brindarles las herramientas necesarias para que en el futuro puedan alcanzar el éxito.Celia, se dedica durante todos los días de la semana a su negocio de venta de deliciosas salteñas, mientras ofrece su apetitoso bocado para no perder tiempo se dedica a tejer con sus ágiles y talentosas manos hermosas gorras, chalinas y guantes que vende al por mayor en el mercado Laguna Temporal de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a su constancia y dedicación desde que se convirtió en padre y madre de sus 4 queridos hijos tiene la satisfacción de ofrecerles tranquilidad y sobre todo educación

loans.use: Increase in capital to be able to continue offering her beautiful weavings

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a woman of much courage and bravery. The loss of her husband granted her these characteristics that now help her to take the reins of her home. With her first loan, after a lot of time of having been dedicated to agriculture, she acquired a calf, and with it, her economic situation has improved notably. With many dreams of continuing down the path of progress, she hopes to obtain a loan to purchase another calf, and little by little to establish a small stable.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yolanda, es una mujer de mucho coraje y valentía. La pérdida de su esposo le otorgó estas características que ahora le ayudan a llevar las riendas de su hogar. Con un primer préstamo después de mucho tiempo de haberse dedicado a la agricultura adquirió una vaquita y con ella su economía ha mejorado notablemente. Con muchos deseos de continuar por la senda del progreso desea obtener un préstamo para comprar una vaquita más y así poco a poco establecer su pequeño establo.

loans.use: Purchase of a small calf

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is an enthusiastic woman who always watches out for the well-being of her family. She has always encouraged the members of her family through work even in difficult times. Years ago, she made a living entirely through agriculture, but now she also raises cows and bulls, and these activities take care of the needs of her home. With many hopes of continuing to improve, she is requesting a loan to fix up the facilities of her stable since she has thought about increasing the number of cows that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gloria es una mujer entusiasta que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia, es así que ella siempre alentó a los miembros de su hogar hacia el trabajo aún en tiempos difíciles. Años atrás se dedicaba enteramente a la agricultura y ahora también a la crianza de vacas y toros que solventan las necesidades de su hogar. Con muchos deseos de seguir mejorando solicita un préstamo para adecuar las instalaciones de su establo ya que tiene pensado incrementar el número de sus vaquitas.

loans.use: Improvement of her facilities to raise livestock

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is a young professional who makes a living by sharing her knowledge of marketing at a college through lectures. She also offers beauty products where she works and to the public in general. Thanks to her effort and perseverance, this second job has become an important source of satisfaction for her beloved family. She hopes to increase her working capital to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Betty, es una joven profesional que se dedica a impartir sus conocimientos de mercadotecnia en un instituto superior y de manera paralela también oferta productos de belleza en su centro de trabajo y al público en general.Gracias a su empeño y constancia esta segunda ocupación se ha convertido en un proveedor importante de satisfacción para su amada familia. Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para continuar su labor.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase the products that she offers

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is a very hard working woman and her anxiousness to progress motivates her daily work harvesting grasses for cattle feed. For a long time she has been the principal source of income for her family; now with the help that all of you can provide her the opportunity to begin growing potatoes and corn in her fertile field.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Lucila, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sus ansias de progresa la motivan día a día a dedicarse a la agricultura sembrando pastos para la alimentación del ganado. Durante mucho tiempo esta ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia; ahora y con la ayuda que vosotros podéis brindarle la oportunidad su radio de acción para iniciar la siembra de papa y maíz en sus fértiles campos de cultivo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
Marilú is another example of a woman who carries out multiple roles in her home. She is a full-time mother and also is dedicated to offering services in the municipality of her city, and now to raising rabbits on a small farm that she fixed up at her home. She hopes to continue with this new initiative, and for its complete development, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Marilú, es un ejemplo más de una mujer que desempeña múltiples roles en su hogar, es madre a tiempo completo y adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios en la Municipalidad de su ciudad y ahora a la crianza de cuyes en una pequeña granja que habilitó en su hogar.Desea continuar con esta nueva iniciativa y para un completo desarrollo solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Implementation of her small farm to raise rabbits

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is a young man in the process of establishing his home in the company of his wife, and together they wish to consolidate this union with much work and effort so that the children they have planned to conceive will have everything they need to develop completely. For that reason, they have decided to open an establishment in their home to sell groceries, over-the-counter medicines, sodas, etc. They also offer telephone booth and Internet services. They wish to improve the area where they sell foodstuffs, and thus they are requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo, es un joven que está estableciendo su hogar en compañía de su esposa y juntos desean consolidar esta unión con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo para que los hijos que han planificado concebir tengan lo necesario para su completo desarrollo. Es por esa razón que han decidido abrir un establecimiento en su propia casa para vender abarrotes, medicinas de uso común, gaseosas, etc. También ofrecen el servicio de locutorio e internet.Desean mejorar su espacio de venta de artículos comestibles y a esta razón atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase capital to implement a small grocery store.

loans.name: Anabell

texts.es:
Anabell is a young woman with great wishes of self-improvement; and with her goal of becoming a professional in addition to happily attending school, she offers beauty products through catalog to the general public. With her wish of increasing her working capital, she turns to us with the goal of requesting a loan to accomplish this.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Anabell, es una joven con muchos deseos de superación y por el inmenso anhelo de convertirse en una excelente profesional además de acudir con mucha alegría a su centro de estudios, se dedica a ofertar artículos de belleza por catálogos al público en general.Con el deseo de incrementar su capital de trabajo recurre a vosotros a fin de solicitar un préstamo para este fin.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Yenni

texts.es:
Yenni is a mother who is very dedicated to the care of her children. One year ago, she decided to start a business producing bricks as a source of income that would allow her to maintain her 2 children, who are still small, and support her husband so that he may become the best engineer in their city. She wishes to increase production and expand her market for which she requests a loan that will be invested in the purchase of basic materials needed for the production of bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Yenni, es una madre de familia muy dedicada al cuidado de sus hijos. Desde hace un año decidió incursionar en la fabricación de ladrillos como fuente de ingreso que le permita sostener a sus 2 hijos que son todavía pequeños y apoyar a su esposo para convertirse en el mejor ingeniero de su ciudad. Ella desea incrementar su producción y expandir su mercado para lo cual solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de insumos necesarios para la fabricación de los ladrillos.

loans.use: Purcahse materials for the production of bricks.

loans.name: Maria Estela's Group

texts.en:
One year ago, a group of women in Asunción decided to form the committee “Mujeres trabajando juntas” (women working together) in order to bring prosperity to their families. They all have one thing in common: the dream of becoming successful entrepreneurs in order to bring benefits to their sons.

Among the businesses these ladies run are: grocery stores, sales of fruits, remedies, furniture, coal and vegetables. The money provided by this Kiva loan will be used to purchase merchandise in some cases and raw materials in others.

Maria Angelica V.'s "Women Working Together" group was formed under the "Committee of Entrepreneuring Women" program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya. The programtargets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to achieve success.

loans.use: The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is a hard-working mother who, after observing her family’s pressing needs as they developed, took the initiative to offer stockings and other similar items as a peddler in the fairs in her community. She wishes to increase her working capital, and for this reason she makes this important request since it will also enable to offer better variety.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabina, es una trabajadora madre de familia, que observando las necesidades de apremiantes de su familia conforme estos se iban desarrollando, tomó la iniciativa de ofertar medias y demás artículos interiores de manera ambulante en las ferias de su comunidad.Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo y a esta razón atiende su importante petición ya que con el incremento también habrá mayor oferta.

loans.use: Purchase capital to offer a greater variety of garments.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis has a project in mind to be able to sell appliances in a stable way. He started his own business a year and a half ago, with the help of one of his brothers, distributing used appliances , principally washing machines and 24 inch televisions, which he fixes and sells at modest prices. He travels to the cities of Lima and Arequipa to sell them but he started to expand his market to other cities such as Nazca and Ica and will soon be able to open a rented space in the city of Lima. Luis follows his dream working hard to fix these appliances, which is the reason for which he is requesting a loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of a great quantity of parts.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Luis, tiene un proyecto en mente poder vender artefactos de manera estable y emprendió su propio negocio hace un año y medio por medio de uno de sus hermanos que trabaja en una empresa exportadora de artefactos usados, los cuales arregla para luego ofertarlos a módicos precios, principalmente lavadoras y televisores de 24 pulgadas el se va de viaje a las ciudades de Lima y Arequipa para venderlos pero empezó a expandir su mercado a otras ciudades como Nazca e Ica, y próximamente podrá establecerse en un local alquilado en la ciudad de Lima, mientras tanto Luis persigue ese sueño trabajando arduamente en el arreglo a conciencia de estos artefactos y es la razón por la cual ahora solicita un préstamo a fin de invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de repuestos.

loans.use: To buy the parts to continue with the repair of appliances.

loans.name: Deltha

texts.es:
Deltha has been in business for 22 years. First, she sold beer and sodas. Then, she started selling books and various other products. Now, she has a store located in her house where she rents children’s costumes. She is always changing the items in her store according to competition.

For 18 years Deltha has also rented sound equipment and lights for parties. Her clients are her neighbors who constantly seek her services when there are "quinceañeras" (fifteenth birthday parties) or other birthdays. She is planning to buy a location and rent it for events like parties or dances. With the loans received, Deltha has bought more products to offer in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Deltha es parte de los negocios desde hace 22 años. Primero, ella vendía cerveza y gaseosa. Luego, empezó a vender artículos de librería y bazar. Actualmente, tiene una bodega ubicada en su casa donde ofrece al público el alquiler de disfraces infantiles. Ella siempre está variando la mercadería de su tienda de acuerdo a la competencia.

Deltha desde hace 18 años se dedica, también, al alquiler de equipo de sonido y luces sicódelicas para animar fiestas. Sus clientes son su vecinos que constantemente la buscan cuando se presentan quinceañeros o cumpleaños.

Ella está planeando comprar un local y alquilarlo para eventos como fiestas o bailes. Con los préstamos que ha adquirido, Deltha ha comprado más productos para ofrecer en su tienda.

loans.use: To buy more items for her store.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia sells chicken in her neighborhood’s market, she has done this for 11 years. She started selling spices, vegetables and groceries, but after seeing the profitability of the business, she decided to sell chicken. Every day, she sells in her store since very early until noon. Basilia has asked for loans to be able to pay for the construction of her house. In addition, she has also helped her husband with the maintenance of the taxi he drives. Later on, Basilia would like to start a store in her house, when she is finished building and furnishing it.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Basilia tiene una avícola en el mercado de su barrio desde hace 11 años. Ella inicialmente vendía espesería, verduras y abarrotes. Pero, luego de ver la rentabilidad del negocio, se decidió por la venta de pollos. Todos los días, ella vende en su avícola desde muy temprano hasta el mediodía. Basilia ha pedido préstamos para poder costear la construcción de su casa. Asimismo, también ha ayudado a su esposo con el mantenimiento mecánico del taxi que él maneja. Más adelante, a Basilia le gustaría poner una tienda en su misma casa, y terminar de construir y lucir su casa.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Two months ago, Miriam started a bookstore in her house. It was her son who gave her the idea to start the store, because he saw that in the neighborhood they needed this type of business. However, for two years Miriam has also been selling shoes by the order.

The loans that she has received have been used to travel to Trujillo, eight hours from Lima to buy wholesale shoes. She travels in selling seasons, like school season, July 28th or Christmas. She brings back between three and four dozens of shoes. Her clients are her neighbors or people her sister knows, Miriam's sister helps in the sales. Miriam wants to buy more merchandise to supply her store and expand it as a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 2 meses, Miriam tiene una librería ubicada en su casa. Fue su hijo quien le dio la idea de poner esta tienda, pues vió que en su barrio hacía falta un negocio de este tipo. Sin embargo, Miriam también se dedica a la venta de zapatos por pedido desde hace 2 años.

Los préstamos que ella ha recibido han sido para viajar a Trujillo, a 8 horas de Lima, y comprar zapatos por mayor. Ella viaja en campañas de ventas, como en época escolar, 28 de julio o Navidad. Trae entre 3 y 4 docenas de zapatos. Sus clientes son sus vecinos o los conocidos de su hermana, quien es intermediaria en la venta. Miriam quiere comprar más mercadería para surtir su tienda y ampliarla como un bazar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for store.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda used to sell buttons and sewing needles on the floor of her neighborhood’s market. With lots of effort, she was able to buy a location in the market. She has worked there for 17 years, selling tableware, plastics, household items and bazaar. In addition, Hilda bought another location next to the one she has. She used to sell glass there, but seeing the profitability of “locutorios” (a phone shop where people can make phone calls at cheap rates) she decided to stop selling glass and turn the location into a phone shop and have videogames for teenagers.

The loans received have been used to build her house, which has three levels, Hilda rents the first level to another family. Hilda has plans to start a store in the space where the phone shop is now located. She already has the racks and display counters that will furnish the store, which she plans to fill out with merchandise in one month.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda vendía botones y agujas en el piso del mercado de su barrio. Con esfuerzo, pudo comprarse un puesto en el mercado. Ahí trabaja desde hace 17 años, donde vende locería, plásticos, artículos para el hogar y bazar. Adicionalmente, Hilda compró otro puesto al costado del que tenía al comienzo. Allí tenía una vidriería, pero viendo la rentabilidad de los locutorios, desde hace un año decidió cambiar de rubro y poner su locutorio de llamadas, además de máquinas de juegos para adolescentes.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para construir su casa, que tiene 3 pisos. Hilda alquila el primer piso de su casa a otra familia. Hilda tiene planes de poner una bodega en el espacio que ahora se encuentra el locutorio. Ella ya cuenta con los andamios y mostradores que amoblaran su bodega, por lo que en un mes empezará a llenarla con mercadería.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for store.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia has been selling chicken soup for 25 years. She used to go out in a street-cart and offer the soup in “La Parada” and “Ventanilla”. Later, she started selling it in her neighborhood’s market. However, four years ago, Mauricia started a soup restaurant in her house. She is open from 5 a.m. to noon.

The loans received have been used to improve the restaurant with furniture, like tables, chairs, tv, etc. Mauricia would like to sell “anticuchos” (small pieces of grilled skewered meat) in the restaurant during the evening, but she needs capital to be able to hire personnel.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Mauricia vende caldo de gallina desde hace 25 años. Ella salía con su carreta y ofrecía su caldo en La Parada y Ventanilla. Luego, empezó a vender en el mercado de su barrio. Pero, desde hace 4 años, Mauricia tiene su restaurante de caldo de gallina en su casa. Ella abre todos los días a las 5 de la mañana y cierra al mediodía.

Los préstamos que ha pedido han servido para mejorar e implementar el restaurante con nueva infraestructura, como mesas, sillas, televisión, etc. Mauricia quisiera vender anticuchos en su restaurante por la noche, pero le falta capital para poder pagar el personal de atención.

loans.use: To hire personnel and be able to open restaurant for longer hours

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias has been laboring in the production of bread for 11 years, but he had to leave that occupation. Currently, he distributes bread wholesale and sells provisions in his small grocery store.

For the past year, he has been purchasing packaged bread from third parties and wakes up at 3 am to distribute it throughout the zones near his neighborhood.

The loans he has previously received have been used to purchase more products for his grocery store. Elías would like to leave the distributing of bread to open a button factory because his brother has told him that it is a good business, however, he needs capital to acquire the machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Elías se ha dedicado a la producción de pan por 11 años. Pero, tuvo que dejar esta labor y, actualmente, se dedica al reparto de pan al por mayor, y a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su bodega.

Desde hace 1 año, él compra pan embolsado a terceras personas y se levanta a las 3 de la mañana a repartirlo por zonas aledañas a su barrio.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar más productos para su bodega. Elías quisiera dejar el reparto de pan y montar una fábrica de botones, porque su hermano le ha contado que es buen negocio. Sin embargo, él necesita de capital para poder adquirir las máquinas.

loans.use: Purchase products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a loving mother who has dedicated the majority of her lifetime to caring for her children. Now that they have each left their parents’ home to form their own families, she has decided to open a small grocery store at home to spend more time with her loving husband. Her need to increase the number of items she offers leads her to request a loan to accomplish her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda, es una amorosa madre que ha dedicado el mayor tiempo D. su vida a cuidar a sus hijos, ahora que cada uno D. ellos ha abandonado el hogar D. sus padres para formar su propia familia ha decidido aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa para compartir mayor tiempo con su amado esposo.Su necesidad D. incrementar la cantidad D. artículos que oferta en este espacio la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para cumplir su objetivo.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda is a diligent and hard-working person. Her constant motivation to improve has allowed her to sell food for many years. Recently she began to sell daily breakfast from a rented space to the people who frequent the area. The warmth and quality of her service have allowed her to increase sales and this has made Teodolinda very happy. She is able to support her 11-year old son and another child that is on the way, and always makes her greatest efforts. She is requesting a loan to repair some chairs and purchase more tables for her restaurant. Support Teodolinda so she can continue successfully in her enterprising business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Teodolinda, es una persona muy trabajadora y diligente su motivación constante de mejorar la ha llevado a dedicarse durante muchos años a la venta de comida, pero recientemente se ha instalado en un local alquilado en el que oferta diariamente desayunos a las personas que transitan por esa zona, la calidez de su atención y el buen servicio ha hecho que mejoren sus ventas y eso alegra bastante a Teodolinda ya que puede sostener a su hijo de 11 años y uno que esta en camino, no escatima sus esfuerzos por la cual ahora solicita un préstamo para reparar algunas de las sillas y comprar más mesas para su local. Apoya a Teodolinda a que continúe exitosamente en su negocio emprendedor.

loans.use: Repair chairs and purchase tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina learned to make “chocotejas”, a candy prepared with chocolate and white caramel, in a community institution two years ago. Since then, she has commercialized this product through her sister, who is her sales representative and makes orders for her. She makes between 50 and 60 “chocotejas” per weekly order.

Carolina says that she has higher sales when it’s a special season, like Mother’s day, Father’s day or Christmas. She remembers that for Mother’s day she set up a display on the window of her house and offered her neighbors “chocotejas” in boxes, stuffed animals and flowers and she was successful with sales. The loans that she has received have been used to buy materials, like molds, brushes, boxes and ingredients. In addition, she has helped her husband buy second handed items, which he buys and sells. Carolina would like to open a bazaar or a bookstore in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Carolina aprendió a elaborar chocotejas, un dulce preparado a base de chcocolate y manjar blanco, en una institución comunal hace dos años. Desde allí, ella se ha dedicado al comercio de este dulce por medio de su hermana, quién es intermediaria de ventas y le hace pedidos. Ella hace entre 50 y 60 chocotejas por pedido semanal.

Carolina dice que tiene mayores ventas cuando es temporada especial, como el día de la madre, día del padre o navidad. Ella recuerda que para el día de la madre puso un pequeño altar en la ventana de su casa y ofreció a sus vecinos chocotejas en cajas, peluches y flores con este motivo. Tuvo éxito en sus ventas. Los préstamos que ella ha recibido los ha utilizado para la compra de sus materiales, como moldes, pinceles, cajas o ingredientes. Igualmente, ha ayudado a su esposo en la compra de artículos de 2da mano, puesto que él se dedica a la compra-venta de estos objetos. A Carolina le gustaría poder abrir un bazar o una librería en el futuro.

loans.use: To purchase materials and ingredients.

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.es:
Macedonia has been selling retail beer and sodas for 8 years. Her husband did not think that she should start her own business, but she didn’t pay any attention to him and began to sell her beverages. In addition, Macedonia sells homemade lollipops and gives her brother-in-law and his children a food allowance every day. The loans that she has received have helped her to construct and finish her home. Now Macedonia plans to start a grocery store, and she needs to create adequate space in her house where she can install the business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Macedonia vende cerveza y gaseosas al por menor desde hace 8 años. Su esposo nunca estuvo de acuerdo con que ella pusiera un negocio, pero ella no le prestó atención y empezó a vender sus bebidas. Igualmente, Macedonia se ha dedicado a la venta de chupetes caseros y da pensión alimenticia a su cuñado e hijos todos los días. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para la construcción y acabado de su casa. Ahora, Macedonia tiene planes de poner una tienda de abarrotes, puesto que ya ha adecuado un espacio de su casa para este negocio.

loans.use: House construction

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María sold lunch specials in her own café, next to her home. Nonetheless, she stopped working there because her daughter, who had helped her with the business, got married. María has now rented the space to a third party and she receives monthly rent from them. María has used the loans she has received to build her home, but now her goal is to complete construction.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María vendía menú en un local propio, al costado de su casa. Sin embargo, ella dejó esta tarea, porque su hija, quien la ayudaba en el negocio, se casó. Actualmente, María ha alquilado el local a terceras personas y recibe una renta mensual. María ha utilizado sus préstamos recibidos para construir su casa, por lo que entre sus planes está acabarla de construir.

loans.use: Complete home construction

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María has two cars that are used as taxis. Her husband works as a taxi driver in one car, and the second is rented to a third person. In addition, María works selling fruit lollipops in the summer, sells cosmetics by catalog, and sells custom clothing.

The loans that she has received in the past have been used to maintain the cars or purchase spare parts or tires.

María is currently taking computer classes and wants to be a junior accountant. She plans on developing a career in that profession. Nonetheless, she would like to purchase more vehicles and have a taxi company.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María tiene dos autos que los trabaja como taxi. Su esposo se desempeña como taxista en un carro, y el otro, lo alquila a una tercera persona. Además, ella vende chupetes de frutas en verano, ofrece cosméticos por catálogo y vende ropa a pedido.

Los préstamos que ha recibido han sido para el mantenimiento de los autos o la compra de repuestos y llantas.

Actualmente, María está estudiando computación, y quiere ser auxiliar contable, por lo que su plan a futuro es desempeñarse en su profesión. No obstante, a ella le gustaría poder comprar más vehículos y tener una empresa de taxi.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a very hard-working woman who entered the commercial world led by the desire to improve her family’s quality of life. She sells beauty products by catalog, and her work, thanks to her daily efforts, has given her great satisfaction. For this reason she would like to increase her total investment.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Norma, esa una dama muy trabajadora que se inició en el mundo comercial a raíz de su ímpetu por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Vende productos de belleza por catálogo y su trabajo gracias al esfuerzo en su desempeño diario le ha otorgado muchas satisfacciones y por esa razón desea incrementar el monto de su inversión.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to offer a greater quantity of products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofia is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to planting feed and raising sheep in a space in her home. Through these activities, she has been able to contribute to achieving her children's dreams, and her family's quality of life has increased notably. She wishes to continue with her work and, for this reason, is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Sofía, es una mujer D. mucho empeño que se dedica a sembrar forraje y criar ovejas en un espacio D. su casa, a través D. estas actividades ha podido contribuir con el cumplimiento D. los sueños D. sus amados hijos y la calidad D. vida D. su familia se ha incrementado notablemente.Desea continuar con su labor y a esa razón atienD. su solicitud.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve the animal rearing conditions and plant a great quantity of feed.

loans.name: Yacin

texts.es:
Yacin is a native of Chucos and he comes from a farming and cattle-raising home. His parents' instruction has granted him the opportunity to support his family and also develop personally. He owns a large cattle farm and now his urgent wish is to increase the nutritional value of his cow's food to that they may produce more milk.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Yacin, es natural de Chucos y proviene de una cuna netamente agricultora y ganadera, las enseñanzas de sus padres le han otorgado la posibilidad de mantener satisfactoriamente a su familia y de desarrollarse también personalmente.Posee una gran ganadería y ahora su urgente deseo es incrementar el valor nutricional del alimento de sus vaquitas para que estas puedan producir mayor cantidad de leche.

loans.use: Purchase balanced nutrition for his beloved cows.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith is an excellent farmer. In the company of her beloved husband, she is dedicated to sowing potatoes, maize, and oca (an Andean root vegetable) in her fertile land. Additionally, she also is devoted to rearing pigs, which she sells in her city's market, and recently to selling grain. She began these last two activities with the intent to improve her beloved family's quality of life. She wishes to continue to generate income for her children's development and, for this reason, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Edith, es una excelente agricultora; en compañía de su amado esposo se dedica a sembrar papa, maíz y oca en sus fértiles tierras, de manera adicional también se dedica a la crianza de cerditos para ofertarlos en las ferias de su ciudad y recientemente a la venta de granos, éstas dos últimas actividades con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su amada familia.Desea seguir generando ingresos para el desarrollo de sus pequeños y a esa razón atiende su petición.

loans.use: Capital so that she may continue developing her farming activities.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita makes a living by raising animals in her small stable and by selling the products that she grows in the markets of her city. A little while ago, she started selling her vegetables in the capital of her country. Her wish is to improve the quality of them so they're better received on her trips.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rita, se dedica a la crianza D. animales en su pequeño establo y a la comercialización D. los productos que cultiva en las ferias D. su ciudad. Hace poco ha iniciado la venta D. sus vegetales en la capital D. su país y su deseo es mejorar la calidad D. estos para tener mayor acogida en sus viajes.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve the quality of her products

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery is always the person who motivates the other members of her family to continue despite the failures that could exist. She demonstrated this when the production of potatoes that they hoped for wasn't satisfactory because of the low prices that didn't compensate the months of effort it took to farm them. This was a considerable failure that harmed their family financially. In spite of this, she tried to get ahead, and with the help of her family, they decided to put more effort into the purchase, fattening, and sale of livestock, an activity that is helping them recover from the crisis. Her request is due to her hope to improve the nutrition of her animals to obtain a better price in the markets in her city.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Mery, siempre es la persona que motiva a los demás integrantes de su familia a continuar a pesar de los fracasos que puedan existir. Ella lo demostró cuando la producción de papa que esperaban obtener no fue satisfactoria por el bajo precio que no compensaba los meses de esfuerzo en su cultivo, esto fue un fracaso considerable que perjudicó la economía de su hogar y ha pesar de eso trato de salir adelante y junto a su familia decidieron impulsar más sus esfuerzos en la compra, engorde y venta de ganado, actividad con la que están recuperándose de esa crisis. Su solicitud es por el deseo de mejorar la alimentación de sus animalitos para obtener una mejor cotización en las ferias de su ciudad.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve the nutrition of her animals

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora has dedicated herself to agricultural work for a long time, and with her continued work, she has been able to contribute to her home and to the fulfillment of each one of her beloved son's dreams. She has in mind to improve the quality and quantity of her production, and this is the reason she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Flora, se dedica desde hace mucho a la labor agrícola y con su continuo desempeño ha podido contribuir con su hogar y con el cumplimiento de cada uno de los sueños de su amado hijo. Tiene en mente mejorar la calidad y cantidad de su producción y a esa razón atiende la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is a young mother who has always pursued the best for her small, one-year-old daughter. She is a promoter of a prestigious brand of pots and pans. On weekends, she sells them independently happily explaining the merits of her kitchen products to hundreds of mothers in her city. She wishes to increase her amount of stock and for this reason is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Eva, es una joven madre de familia que siempre ha buscado lo mejor para su pequeña niña de una año. Es promotora de una prestigiosa marca de ollas y sartenes y los fines de semana los oferta de manera independiente explicando muy contenta sobre las bondades de sus objetos para la cocina de centenares de madres de familia de su ciudad.Desea incrementar la oferta de las mismas y a esa razón atiende su petición.

loans.use: More capital so she may offer a greater quantity of pots and pans.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta recently became a mother and this immense happiness gave her the opportunity to open a small shop in her house so she could contribute to her family and, of course, to the well-being of her little one. The popularity of this small space has been increasing day-by-day, and for this reason, she wishes to improve it by purchasing a greater quantity of stock so she may satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta, recientemente se ha convertido en madre y esa inmensa alegría le ha dado la posibilidad también de aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa para contribuir con los suyos y por supuesto para generarle bienestar a su pequeño.La popularidad de este pequeño espacio se ha ido incrementando día a día y por esta razón desea mejorar su administración con la compra de mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad para la satisfacción plena de sus clientes.

loans.use: An increase in capital so she may expand her product mix.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, thanks to savings that she has been able to accumulate, has become one of the most important people, as far as the distribution of bricks goes. She has made diverse contacts with the manufacturing families which enables her to acquire excellent prices for her distribution in construction areas. This work has granted her satisfaction and, with this motivation, she wishes to improve her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, gracias a los ahorros que ha logrado acumular se ha podido convertir en una de las personas más importantes en lo que a distribución de ladrillos se refiere. Realiza contactos diversos con las familias fabricantes y los adquiere a un excelente precio para su distribución en las zonas de construcción.Esta labor le ha otorgado satisfacciones y por ese motivo desea mejorar su capital de trabajo.

loans.use: Increase working capital for her distribution and collection of bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products, kitchen items and other goods for a small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of products for her small beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in home products to sell in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beauty products to grow her business

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 43 year-old Rukia R., who is single and has three children aged 7, 15, and 18. She has one other dependent who lives with her because she is an orphan. In 2005, Rukia established her small general store. Working seven days a week, 13 to 16 hours a day, assisted by one employee, she earns about $100 every month from this business. Rukia now requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of soda, water, cooking oil, and candy. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $65. In the future, Rukia plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soda, water, cooking oil, and candy in bulk.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Neema M., who is married and has six children between the ages of 15 and 30. She has two dependents. In 2002, Neema established her poultry business and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks in bulk as well as feed and preventative medicines. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku, the Swahili word for ‘chickens.’ Raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Debora M., who is married and has one child, aged 10. In 2005, Debora established her crop wholesaling business. Working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $90 every month from this business. Debora now requires a loan in order to purchase additional bulk supplies of rice, maize, and beans. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. Debora thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, maize, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia is 46 years old, and is three years younger than her husband whose name is A. W.. Her husband runs a small tea shop. However, her husband's shop is out of tea. Therefore, Razia is requesting a loan of $1,450.  She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Kosar wants a loan to repair her rickshaw; Irshad wants a loan to expand her food business; Kosar wants loan to expand her clothing sheets business; and Kosar wants to expand her business of making bleach and cleaning solvents.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Priscar

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Priscar M., who is married and has no children. In 2003, Priscar established her pharmacy business. Assisted by her husband and one employee, working seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $100 per month. Priscar now requires a loan in order to add to her inventory of medicines. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $87. In the future, Priscar plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of medicines.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Agatha M., who is widowed and has two children aged 4 and 8. She has one other dependent living with her who attends school in town. In 2000, Agatha established her general store which she operates six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of oil, sugar, salt, and soap in bulk. In the future, Agatha plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of oil, sugar, salt, and soap in bulk.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is Jane S., who is married and has no children and one dependent. In 2006, Jane established her snacks and soft drinks business. Working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $110 every month. Jane has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional bulk stocks of soda, as well as ingredients to make a new range of snacks. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional bulk stocks of soft drinks, as well as ingredients to make a new range of snacks.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Edina M., who is married and has two children aged 5 and 12. She also has two other dependents living with her because they are attending school in the area. In 2000, Edina established her fish and soft drinks business. Assisted by her husband and two employees, working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $80 per month. Edina now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fish and soft drinks in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $87. In the future, Edina plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Sifa L., who is married and has one child, aged 5. She has one other dependent who lives with her because she is an orphan. In 2003, Sifa established her salon. Assisted by her sister, she operates her business seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day. Sifa has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to expand her range of haircare products and wigs. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To expand her range of haircare products and wigs.

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en: Hajra A. R. is a 52 year old widow who resides in the city of Kasur, Pakistan, which is famous for its sweetmeat. She has a two room brick house and she is the mother of four sons. Her first two sons, named Rashid Mahmood and Nasir Mahmood, make decorative embroidery. Hajra's third son, named Talat Mahmood, is a worker in a factory. Talat was educated until 10th standard. The youngest son is a worker in a sugar factory, and he was educated until 8th standard. Hajra is now applying for a loan of $1,350 for her third son, Talat, who wants to start a small restaurant specializing in breakfast and a Punjabi food named Nan Chana.  Hajra has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Mumtaz wants to buy spare parts for her machines; Mumtaz wants a loan to buy cloth for selling; Naila wants a loan to expand her repairing business; Parveen wants a loan to expand her card business.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 29 year-old Joyce K., who is married and has four children aged between 1 and 9. In 2007, Joyce established her poultry business. Working seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $110 every month from this business. Joyce now requires a loan to purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics, and she hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $43. In the future, Joyce plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about ‘kuku,’ the Swahili word for ‘chickens.’ Raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons that raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Mwanahawa M., who is married and has two children, one aged three and one four months. She also has one other dependent living with her because he attends school in town. In 2007, Mwanahawa established her video show business. Assisted by her one employee, working seven days a week, five to eight hours a day, she earns about $130 every month.

Mwanahawa now requires a loan in order to expand the range of videos which she shows for an entrance fee. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $43. In the future, Mwanahawa plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To expand the range of videos and DVDs which she shows at selected times for a small entrance fee.

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en: Sarwar is 36 years old and is married to T. Mahmood, who is 43 years old. She lives in a two room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter and four sons, and her daughter is in kindergarten. Her eldest son, who is 12 years old, works in a shoe factory. The next oldest also makes shoes. Sarwar herself sells milk. She has applied for a loan of $1,250 for her husband who wants to lease land on contract and thereby earn the income necessary to educate Ali Ahsan and Danish, their younger sons.  Sarwar has been joined in her loan group by a few more members:  Nasreen wants to expand her business of repairing local busses; Sakina wants to expand her food distributing business; Razia wants to expand her gentlemen's shoe business; and Bismillah wants to buy an auto-rickshaw.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Tatu M., who is married and has two children aged five and eight. In 2005, Tatu established her crop wholesaling business. Assisted by her husband, working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $40 every month. Tatu now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans, and sunflower seeds in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $40. In the future, Tatu plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans, and sunflower seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 47 year-old Emma M., who is married and has six children aged between 7 and 24. In 1999, Emma established her poultry and cattle business. She has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku, which is Swahili for ‘chickens.’ Raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons that raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Rachel S., who is married and has four children aged between 2 and 9. In 2005, Rachel established her poultry business and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku, which is Swahili for 'chickens.' Raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons that raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics.

loans.name: Eneta

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Eneta K., who is married and has four children aged between 9 and 15. In 2006, Eneta established her barber shop and scrap metal business. Working seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $170 every month. Eneta now requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of scrap metal, a machine for charging car batteries, and electric clippers and shavers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $95. In the future, Eneta plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of scrap metal in bulk, a machine to charge car batteries, and electric clippers and shavers.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Anne S., who is married and has five children aged between 18 and 27. In 2000, Anne established her crop wholesaling business. Assisted by her husband, and working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $40 every month from this business. Anne has already received and repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional bulk stocks of rice. In the future, Anne plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

This client is a perfect example of why microfinance works and why the overwhelming majority of clients repay their loans. Many people who hear about microfinance (or kiva.org) for the first time ask anxiously, “How do you make sure people pay back? Won’t they just take the money?” Firstly, most MFIs have due diligence processes in place to assess client risk, as well as measures such as collateral arrangements and group lending (where a defaulted loan is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk. More important than any of these deterrents, however, is the incentive clients have to start a business, build a business, and repay their loan so that they can get another and another and another… The incentive to have on-going access to financial services from which they had previously been excluded is a powerful one.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Balquis' Group

texts.en:
Balquis is the widow of A. D., and was left without any financial support.  Balquis didn’t lose hope and struggled against the adverse circumstances because she knew that she needed to care for her children. So she started a grocery shop through a microloan which she took from Asasah. She has earned profit on her shop and has been able to support her children. She has now applied for a loan of $925 to diversify her grocery shop into a store and keep the products like rice, cooking oil and sugar.   
She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members:  Asia wants a loan to buy a grinding machine; Naseem wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit; and Sakina and Seema want loans to buy auto-rickshaws on installments. 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

(Seema Baji on the above picture was not present that time)

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Jenipher

She has one other dependent who lives with her because she is attending school in the area. In 2005, Jenipher established her general store where, working six days a week, and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $330 every month. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $45. In the future, Jenipher plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25 year-old Amina M., who is married and has four children aged between 3 and 9. In 2006, Amina established her used clothing business which, with the assistance of her husband, she operates six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day. Amina now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $90. In the future, Amina plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything Western or modern. While there are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Mwajabu L., who is married and has two children aged 2 and 10. In 2008, Mwajabu established her café business and now she requires a loan in order to purchase additional ingredients, such as rice, beans, and maize, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients such as rice, maize, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Subi

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Subi J., who is married and has four children. In 2001, Subi established her salon business, and she now requires a loan in order to purchase two chairs, wall tiles, a television, and a setting machine for her salon. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To purchase two chairs, wall tiles, a television and a hair setting machine.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Rita M.. She is single and has two children aged 16 and 25. She also has two other dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. In 2005, Rita opened a general store. Working six days a week, and more than 16 hours a day, she earns about $870 a month. Fortunately, she receives help from her sister and two employees. Rita has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and has applied for a new loan to buy additional stocks of soft drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $210. In the future, Rita plans to increase the quantity and range of items she has for sale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of soft drinks and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Eva M.. She is married, and has three children aged 8, 10, and 16. In 2000, Eva established her rice and used clothing business. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and used clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothing arrives in Dar es Salaam from America and Europe. It is then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers to retailers. The retailers re-wash and re-iron the clothing in preparation for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generations, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything western or modern.

Some argue that the popularity of cast-offs from the West is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and used clothing
