Mirian sells clothing in the well-known market located in the city of San Lorenzo. She inherited the business from her mother, who is very old and cannot take care of the business anymore. Mirian’s husband makes the clothes in their house and then they sell it.

After a lot of effort, they were able to build their own house. Moreover, she bought a motorcycle in order to sell the clothing in the neighboring towns.

The couple dreams of opening their own store.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for women and men

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is a pleasant pharmacist who set up a small drugstore in order to provide health services to the families in her community. Her broad knowledge in this line of work has helped her meet her needs and reach some goals. She is married and has 2 lovely children, for whom she works so hard. They have become the engine that drives her to get ahead, which is why she is not content with just owning a drugstore. She would like to expand her shop as well as open up a small bookstore, which is really needed in the community. In order to reach her goal, she would have to raise the funds necessary to buy the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa, es una simpática farmacéutica que instaló una pequeña botica en su comunidad para brindar servicios de salud a las familias de su comunidad. El buen desempeño de sus conocimientos la a ayudado a satisfacer sus necesidades y a alcanzar algunas aspiraciones.Ella es casada y tiene 2 hermosos hijos por quienes lucha y se han convertido en el motor que la impulsa a salir adelante y es por ellos que no quiere conformarse con tener una botica, sino que desea ampliarla y abrir una pequeña librería que es muy necesaria en su comunidad.Para este deseo tendría que reunir una suma de dinero que le servirá para la compra de mercadería necesaria para alcanzar este deseo.

loans.use: Set up a small bookstore

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva has always had a tendency to have more than one job. And so she equipped a small space in her cellar for use as a beauty parlor. Her good work in both occupations has earned her a lot of popularity and her premises are frequented daily by members of her community. She wishes to continue with this work and has decided to renovate her small space so that she can provide more comfort to her clients.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Elva, siempre ha tenido la tendencia de ocuparse en más de un oficio. Por esa razón en el pequeño espacio de su bodega acondicionó un módulo para desempeñarse también como cosmetóloga. Su buen trabajo en ambos oficios le ha otorgado popularidad y su local es muy visitado por los miembros de su comunidad a diario.Desea continuar con su labor y ha decidido implementar sus pequeños espacios para acoger con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To renovate her small working premises.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Miss Karen, 27 years of age, managed to set up a food and beverage business in her parents’ house, where she lives. Her parents have always thought of her well-being and supported her in all the decisions that she has had to make. As a single mother, she has many responsibilities and great aspirations as well. One of those goals is to expand her business and sell fruit, like her parents do. However, he small budget has not been favorable lately, so she is requesting that we support her with a loan that will be invested in the fruit market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Karen a sus 27 años ha logrado establecer un negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas en la casa de sus padres, con quienes vive y quienes le han apoyado en todas las decisiones que ha tomado pensando en su bienestar.Ella siendo madre soltera tiene grandes responsabilidades y grandes aspiraciones también, siendo una de ellas ampliar su negocio y dedicarse también a la compra y venta de frutas como sus padres.Pero su bajo presupuesto no le ha sido favorable en estos últimos tiempos y solicita le apoyemos con un préstamo que será únicamente invertido en iniciar su proyecto de venta de frutas.

loans.use: Set up fruit market

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa manages to balance a successful business with her family of four. She is a small entrepreneur from Khoost where she works as a market vendor selling all sorts of small retail items. Larisa started her venture about a year ago. However, her business has seen fast growth and today she is making about $1000 in profit each month. 

Larisa is very open-hearted and friendly with all her customers. She tries to be optimistic even in the most frustrating situations. Not long ago someone stole her wallet with all her monthly profit. However, Larisa handled that challenge really well. Today she is seeking a loan of 2000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital and help build her sales.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is a responsible mother who had to take control of her household when her husband had an accident in the brutal jungle. She makes beautiful handicrafts for home decoration in her city, but she has always had one problem that has thwarted production: the materials she needs are very costly. For this reason, she has decided to buy a greater quantity of supplies so that she can increase the number of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Adela, es una responsable madre de familia que tomó las riendas de su hogar, cuando su esposo se accidentó en la agreste S.. Se dedica a realizar bellos trabajos artesanales para la decoración de los hogares de su ciudad, pero siempre ha tenido un inconveniente que ha perjudicado el incremento de su producción ya que los materiales que utiliza son costosos, por esa razón ha decidido comprar en mayor volumen sus herramientas a fin de acrecentar el número de sus artículos.

loans.use: Purchase of more handicraft materials in order to boost production

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba is a single mother, but this hasn't stopped her from getting ahead. On the contrary, she has gained a good reputation for her work in the agricultural sector. For a long time, this was the only activity which provided an income for her family, and Elba would now like to set up a grocery store, as she has noticed the need for one in her community.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Elba es madre soltera y su condición no ha limitado su progreso, por el contrario le ha otorgado una importante fortaleza para su desempeño agrícola. Durante mucho tiempo esta ha sido la única actividad que ha sostenido a su familia y ahora desea implementar una bodega ya que ha observado la necesidad de su comunidad.

loans.use: To set up a small grocery store at home.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a daughter. She runs a small nail care venture doing manicures and applying artificial nails, acrylics and nail gels. She works in a rented space at a beauty salon center called Mriya (Dream). It’s located in a very favorable place which attracts many potential clients. Ludmila started this business 2 years ago. Presently, she has about $3000 invested in her business. Her net profit is about $1000 a month. 

Ludmila has a unique ability to understand people and build relationships with her customers. Moreover, she can generate new business ideas and handle stress really well. All these characteristics have helped Ludmila reach success in the trade. She wants to grow her venture and continue improving her professional skills as a licensed manicurist. Ludmila is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
We started building an additional room in our house because these houses are too small. As you can see, I have boarded up the windows. I am requesting a loan of $700.00 so that I can both finish building the extra room and add safety to my home by installing window security bars.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

En la casa donde vivo, ya habíamos empezado a construir un cuarto más; dado que estas casas son muy pequeñas y como podrán notar tengo de ventanas unas maderas, solicito $700 dlls. Para darle seguridad a mi vivienda colocándole unas protecciones en sus ventanas Y terminar la construcción de dicho cuarto.

loans.use: Finish building additional room

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Lulu N.. She is widowed and has 3 children, ages 9, 18, and 22. In 2001 Lulu established her liquor store business. Working 7 days a week and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about US$40 every month from this business. She is assisted by her brother and 1 employee. Lulu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of beer and soft drinks in bulk. In the future, Lulu plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or "words" in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of "bar" selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the rural areas, but I’m sure they’re working on it!) The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing: a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a microentrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer and soft drinks in bulk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Agnes M.. She is married and has 1 child, age 6. In 2002 Agnes established her music store and salon business. Working 7 days a week and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about US$30 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband and 1 employee. Agnes has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to expand her range of CDs, cassettes, and haircare products. In the future, Agnes plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of CDs, tapes, and haircare products

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is a young farmer who grows star fruit, a delicious fruit found in the jungles of his country. He started his farm with the help of his beloved siblings. Because of his labor of love and his many future goals for his family’s well-being, he would like to increase his work capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis, es un joven agricultor que se dedica a la producción de carambolas, exquisito fruto de la selva de su país. Incursionó en esta labor con la importante ayuda de sus queridos hermanos y debido a que tiene gran amor por su labor y muchas metas a futuro en bienestar de su familia desea incrementar su capital de trabajo.

loans.use: Increase capital to raise production

loans.name: Mwanapwani

texts.en: Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Mwanapwani A.. She is married and has 5 children, aged between 4 and 14. She has 1 dependent, who lives with her because he is her younger brother. In 2004 Mwanapwani established her crop wholesaling business. Mwanapwani requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and beans in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and beans in bulk

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa* and Alfredo are a married couple who have been growing citrus fruits for over 30 years. After much effort in this field, they have been able to meet the needs of their only child, who is 2 years old. Their desire to help their son’s wishes come true drives them to request a loan in order to improve the quality of their crops and increase production.

*Only Alfredo is pictured above. Elsa was working outside of the region when Kiva's partner MFI (Microfinanzas PRISMA) took this picture.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa y Alfredo, son una pareja de esposos que se dedica al cultivo de cítricos por mas de 30 años y que con el esfuerzo puesto en su labor han podido satisfacer las necesidades de su único hijo de 2 años. Su deseo de contribuir con el cumplimiento de los sueños a futuro de su pequeño los conducen a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos e incrementar su número.

loans.use: Increase capital to improve crop quality and quantity

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
The primary economy of Paraguya relies on beef cattle an on agriculture. With this in mind, Perfecto P. purchases livestock. In current day he has 20 milk cows, 14 calves, and 4 horses. Perfecto sells the milk and he starts his days in the early hours of the morning to care for his cows and to later distribute and make his sales with a small cart.

Perfecto cares for his animals as if they were his daughters, each one even has a name. Perfecto cares for them with a great leave of love and they always obey him.

In future Perfecto wishes to purchase a car to facilitate the distribution of his milk products.

The funds of the credit requested will be invested in milk processing machines to prepare for sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Las principales actividades económicas del Paraguay son la ganadería y la agricultura. Teniendo en cuenta esto, Perfecto P. compro animales; actualmente cuenta con 20 vacas lecheras, 14 vaquillas y 4 caballos. Perfecto vende leche y se levanta tempranas horas de la madrugada para ordenar las vacas y así después procesarlas para luego distribuirlas y venderlas en su carrito.

Perfecto cuida a sus vacas como si fueron sus hijas, inclusive cada una de ellas tiene nombre, y Perfecto las trata con mucho cariño, es por eso que ellas siempre lo obedecen. En un futuro Perfecto desea comprar un automóvil que le facilite la distribución de la leche.

El dinero del crédito solicitado será invertido en maquinas para el procesamiento de la leche para su venta.

loans.use: To purchase a milk processing machine.

loans.name: Saturno

texts.es:
Mr. Saturno E. is a father who, after much effort and thanks to his love of agriculture, has made use of this field in order to meet his family’s needs. He has always tried to help realize his loved ones’ wishes. Now that he and his beloved wife are alone, he would like to increase his work buy planting more crops for his benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Saturno, es un padre que con mucho esfuerzo y gracias al amor que siente por la labor agrícola ha podido valerse de ella para satisfacer las necesidades de su querida familia y ha tratado de contribuir con el cumplimiento de los sueños de los suyos, ahora que goza sólo de la compañía de su querida esposa desea incrementar su labor con la siembra de mayor cantidad de productos para su beneficio.

loans.use: Increase capital to raise production

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en: Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Zubeda C.. She is widowed and has 4 children, aged between 5 and 16. In 2000 Zubeda established her café and crop wholesaling business. Zubeda has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and maize in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and maize in bulk

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is the mother of 5 young children. She and her husband work diligently for their family’s well-being. They grow guanabana (soursop) fruit for a living, but they would like to improve their annual production so that they can use the profits to increase next year’s crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel, es madre de cinco pequeños niños y en compañía de su amado esposo se desempeña con mucha diligencia para otorgarles bienestar, siembran guanábanas y su deseo es mejorar su producción anual para destinar las ganancias al incremento de productos para su próximo siembra.

loans.use: Improve quality and increase quantity of guanabana (soursop) fruit

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa R. is a loving mother who upon noticing the financial troubles her family was experiencing, decided to create her own source of income in her home. Thanks to her efforts, her general store has become well-known and quite frequented every day of the week. Rosa’s wish is to improve her business space so that she can serve more customers with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Rosa, es una amorosa madre de familia que observando la necesidad por la que atravesaba su familia decidió implementar su propia fuente de ingreso en casa, gracias a su esfuerzo ésta se ha hecho muy conocida y es bastante concurrida todos los días de la semana. El deseo de Rosa es mejorar su espacio de ventas para acoger a mayor número de clientes con comodidad.

loans.use: Improvement of business space

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Grace K.. She is married and has 2 children, ages 5 and 9. She has 1 dependent. In 2005 Grace established her seamstress business. Grace requires a loan in order to purchase a sewing machine. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Suma

texts.en: Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Suma M.. She is married and has 3 children, ages 15, 19, and 27. She has 2 dependents, who live with her because their parents died of HIV/AIDS. In 1995 Suma established her crop wholesaling business. Working 6 days a week and 1 to 4 hours a day, she earns about US$30 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Suma requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and nuts in bulk. In the future, Suma plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and nuts in bulk

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is a single mother who despite having been the victim of a river flood, did not let that terrible episode in her life reduce her efforts to keep her young son happy and healthy. She would like to improve the selection in her small candy stand, so she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

NELLY, es madre soltera y a pesar de haber sido víctima del desborde del río, no ha dejado que estos lamentables episodios en su vida aminoren el esfuerzo por mantener a su pequeño contento y sano. Desea mejorar su pequeño stand de dulces y por ese motivo solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Improve selection in small candy stand

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Ms. Juana B., who has been in the meat business for over 9 years, has a small butcher shop in the Cerro Colorado market of the city of Juliaca. Juanita, as she is affectionately called by her customers, is a very kind, loving, and diligent woman who wakes up early everyday and sells fresh and delicious beef and mutton at reasonable prices. With the benefits received from this business, she has managed to improve her quality of life. Above all, she has the satisfaction of providing a higher education for her beloved children. Ms. B.’s wish is to invest in her business and earn greater profits so that she and her family can enjoy financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Dentro del mercado cerro colorado de la ciudad de Juliaca tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de carnes rojas doña Juana, quien hace más de 9 años, está dedicada a esta noble labor. Juanita como cariñosamente la llaman sus clientes y amistades es una mujer muy cariñosa, amable y diligente que durante todos los días de la semana desde muy temprano se dirige a su puestito de venta para ofrecer a sus clientes sus frescas y deliciosas carnes de res y cordero a precios cómodos.Con los beneficios que obtiene con este negocio está logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y sobre todo tiene la satisfacción de ofrecerles estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos. El deseo de doña Juanita es contar con mayor capital para invertir en su negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos para gozar de tranquilidad junto a su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of meats

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is a young man of 20 who a few months ago decided to start his family alongside Lili, his faithful and hardworking wife. With the hopes of living in a loving and happy home, they will soon be bringing their beloved son into the world, and they would like to offer him stability. These young parents would like to increase their selection and stock. Lili set up this business 4 years ago, and now José would like to move it forward. They both believe that investing in the business will improve sales, which will allow José to finish his studies, thus offering his family security like any responsible father. For this reason, José is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

José, es un joven de 20 años de edad, hace algunos meses decidió formar su familia al lado de Lili, su fiel y laboriosa esposa, con la esperanza de vivir en un hogar lleno de amor y felicidad, ahora están apunto de otorgarle la vida a su querido hijo a quien desean ofrecerle tranquilidad.El deseo de estos jóvenes padres es aumentar la variedad y stock de su mercadería; este negocio que Lili emprendió hace más de 4 años y que ahora José desea sacar adelante, ambos consideran que haciendo una inversión mejorarán sus ventas, lo cual le permitirá concluir sus estudios superiores a José y brindarle seguridad a su familia como todo padre responsable. Para ello José solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer greater selection of apparel

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Strength and will are Edith’s main qualities. Since she was a child, she displayed her abilities of being enterprising and diligent, which is why her business endeavors have given her the opportunity to achieve anything that she resolved to do. Thanks to the delicious juices that she sells and her great customer service, she has obtained faithful customers who frequent her stand on a daily basis in order to drink her nutritious nectars. Edith would like to expand her business, so she plans on purchasing chairs, benches, and a blender to offer her customers greater comfort and speedy service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Su fortaleza y voluntad, fueron las principales características de Edith, quien desde niña demostró ser emprendedora y diligente, es por ello las actividades a las que se ha dedicado le han otorgado la posibilidad de concretar lo que se ha propuesto.Gracias a los deliciosos jugos que ofrece y sobre todo a la buena atención que brinda logró obtener asiduos clientes que diariamente concurren a su puestito para consumir sus nutritivos néctares.El deseo de Edith es ampliar e implementar su negocio, para ello tiene pensado adquirir sillas, bancas y licuadora para mayor comodidad y una rápida atención de sus clientes.

loans.use: Improve business space for greater customer comfort

loans.name: Comité Alegría Group

texts.en:
The committee Alegria is very proud of being in its seventh cycle. It is a very old committee that is an example of organization and dynamism for their community. They are like an inspiration for other people in the area. All the members of the committee live in a very poor area of the city of San Lorenzo.

Besides working together, they are more friends than business partners. They all get along very well and they always celebrate everything together, such as weddings, anniversaries, and so on.

They dream of living in a place where everybody can have the same opportunities such as good health care and education. Their goal is to open a supermarket and sewing shops.

Among the businesses they run are grocery stores, hair salons, and sales of perfumes, food, drinks, clothing, fruits, vegetables, and other items. The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of winter clothes, sugar, rice, pasta, drinks, threads, bottoms, fabric, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes, sugar, rice, pasta, drinks, threads, bottoms, fabric, and other items.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina is a perfect example of dedication and effort. Her great motherly love enabled her to leave her home village of Crucero in search of a better life. Nowadays she lives in the city of Juliaca with her four children, for whom she is committed to keep going ahead in life. Since her husband left her, she has been both a mother and a father to her children, working tirelessly en her business, where she buys and sells livestock (poultry and pigs). This is a trade she learned from her humble farming parents. Every weekend Guillermina travels to the small neighboring villages to purchase her animals and to market them at the markets. This is an activity which has given her the satisfaction of providing her beloved children a better quality of life. She is very proud of her children.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermina, es un ejemplo constante de dedicación y esfuerzo, su inmenso amor de madre la llevaron a salir de su pueblo natal Crucero, en busca de un mejor porvenir; actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca con sus 4 menores retoños, por quienes vela y está dispuesta a persistir en la vida.Desde que su esposo la dejó se ha convertido en padre y madre de sus hijos, trabajando incansablemente en su negocio de compra y venta de ganado (ovino y porcino), oficio que aprendió de sus humildes padres ganaderos, Guillermina todos los fines de semana viaja a los pueblitos aledaños para adquirir su ganado y comercializarlos en las ferias.Esta actividad le está dando la satisfacción de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus amados hijos, quienes la llenan de felicidad y orgullo.

loans.use: To offer a larger quantity of livestock.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa is a woman who loves her children and prepared to give her very best so that she can help them get ahead in life. Ever since she was a girl, she has shown a talent for cooking and this talent is reflected in the delicious stews which she prepares in her family home and sells to clients at the Túpac Amaru market in the city of Juliaca. Every day she prepares about 100 dishes and distributes them to her clients who are very happy with her creations. Elsa would like to take out a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients on a wholesale basis so that she can prepare her dishes more economically.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa es una mujer que ama a sus hijos y esta dispuesta a esforzarse y dar lo mejor de sí para sacarlos adelante. Desde niña demostró tener un don especial para la cocina y ese don se ve reflejado en los deliciosos potajes que prepara en el seno familiar y los vende a sus asiduos comensales del mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca.Ella prepara diariamente alrededor de 100 platos y los distribuye a sus clientes que para su agrado quedan satisfechos por cada guiso consumido. El deseo de Elsa es adquirir un préstamo de dinero que tiene pensado invertir en la compra insumos de primera necesidad al por mayor, adquiriendo estos productos la preparación de sus platillos le resultará mucho más económico.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of ingredients for preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is 24 years old. Ever since she was a girl, she has been enterprising and with a great desire to support her humble parents in providing her younger siblings with an education and well-being. It was under these circumstances which she decided to open a grocery store, in which her dear mother also works. Nancy's mother is very proud of her. Nancy is a delightful woman with a lot of aspirations for her business. She predicts that she will be able to improve her income and meet the needs of her clients better by expanding and increasing her range of fruit and vegetables.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy, es una joven de 24 años de edad, desde niña demostró ser una mujer emprendedora con muchísimos deseos de apoyar a sus humildes padres en la educación y bienestar de sus hermanos menores, es por ello que empeñosa decidió abrir su tiendita de abarrotes en la que también atiende su querida madre, quien se siente muy orgullosa de ella.Esta encantadora muchacha tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio, cree que ampliando y aumentando otros insumos de primera necesidad como: verduras y frutas mejoraran sus ingresos y logrará satisfacer la necesidad de sus comensales.

loans.use: To offer a larger number of products.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia is a woman with a humble heart. Since having her loving children she has worked steadily with the end goal that they will never suffer any deprivation and that they will be able to complete a higher education. Currently, in spite of her advanced age, she continues to enjoy the same fortituD., tenacity and diligence with which she began to work. Thanks to these qualities, her business of selling second-hand stuffed animals has granted her much satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Zenovia, es una mujer humilD. D. corazón, desD. que les otorgó el don D. vida a sus queridos hijos trabajó firmemente con el fin D. que no pasen privaciones y puedan concluir sin problemas sus estudios superiores.Actualmente pese a su avanzada edad sigue gozando D. la misma fortaleza, constancia y diligencia con la que empezó a trabajar, gracias a esas cualidades hasta hace poco tiempo su negocio D. venta D. peluches D. segundo uso le ha otorgado muchas satisfacciones.

loans.use: Additional capital to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is the youngest of four brothers. After seeing his brothers become independent and leave the family home, this dedicated young man decided to do the same and to take the reins of his life to forge his future. This is why he currently dedicates himself to selling coats for men, women and children. He brings his merchandise from the city of Desaguadero and sells it in his native city of Juliaca. In addition to this business he also tries to take advantage of any job that he comes across. He hopes to be able to count on additional capital for his business. He thinks that increasing the volume of his merchandise will improve his earnings and the possibility that he will be able pursue a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Juan, es el menor de cuatro hermanos, al ver que estos ya se independizaron y salieron del seno familiar, este joven entusiasta decidió hacer lo propio, tomar las riendas de su vida y forjar su futuro, es por ello que actualmente viene dedicándose a la venta de casacas para caballeros, damas y niños, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de Desaguadero y los vende en su ciudad natal Juliaca, adicionalmente a esta labor trata de aprovechar y ganarse la vida con cualquier trabajo eventual que se le presenta.Él desea contar con mayor capital en su negocio, considera que aumentando el volumen de su mercadería mejorarán sus ingresos y su posibilidad de seguir una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Additional capital to offer a greater quantity of coats.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Criss

texts.es:
Criss comes from a very close home but with little economic resources. Since she started her family more than 5 years ago, she has worked tirelessly so that her 4 year-old daughter can enjoy tranquility and comfort. She started her business selling kitchen utensils but this business was not always profitable which is why she decided to dedicate herself to selling food (selling fried cheese) at the local terminal in the city of Juliaca. Her hard-working husband tries to take advantage of any job which comes along to provide additional income to keep his family without deprivation. Criss is not currently working because she is expecting a beautiful baby who will soon finish filling her home with happiness and love.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Criss, proviene de un hogar muy unido pero de bajos recursos económicos. Desde que formó su familia hace más de 5 años trabajó incansablemente con el fin de que su pequeña niña de 4 añitos de edad pueda gozar de tranquilidad y bienestar. Inició su negocio de venta de utensilios de cocina en forma ambulatoria, pero con este negocio no siempre lograba obtener buenos beneficios, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a la venta de comida (venta de queso frito) en el terminal provincial de la ciudad de Juliaca, mientras que su laborioso esposo trata de aprovechar cualquier trabajo eventual que se le presenta para obtener ingresos extras y poder mantener sin privaciones a su familia.Criss en estos momentos no se encuentra trabajando porque está en espera de un lindo bebé, que dentro de poco tiempo terminará de llenar de alegría y amor su dulce hogar.

loans.use: Additional capital to sell a greater quantity of dishes.

loans.name: Comíté Mujeres Luchando Group

texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Luchando” (women fighting) is a new group in its first cycle. All the members dream of having their own house. Some of them belonged to another group before but they decided to form a new one and start from the beginning. They are all very hard-working people who want to bring benefits to their families.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya that targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities that enable them to live with dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women committee members the energy and motivation to reach success.

Among the businesses they run are grocery stores and businesses selling CDs, fruit, vegetables, clothing, drinks, lingerie, cosmetics, and food.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of sugar, rice, fruits, vegetables, drinks, and fabric.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, fruits, vegetables, drinks, fabric, and other items.

loans.name: Comité Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya that targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities that enable them to live with dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women committee members the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee “Rincon Poty” (Flowers’ corner) is proud to be in its fourth cycle. They have been working with Fundacion Paraguaya for one year.

In 2007, there was an epidemic that affected many people in the whole country. A very affected area was the neighborhood where these ladies live. As a result, four members of the committee got dengue and yellow fever. Since they were not able to work, the generation of income in their families slowed down. The whole group organized different events in the neighborhood in order to raise funds to help the ladies.

The businesses these ladies run are: grocery stores, mini-restaurants, sewing shops, and sales of cosmetics, clothing, remedies, jewelry, and chicken. The money provided by the credit will be invested in: sugar, flour, pasta, winter clothing, fabric, remedies etc.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, pasta, winter clothing, fabrics, remedies etc.

loans.name: Roberta's Group

texts.es:
Roberta, Maria and Maruja are members of the Banco Communal Señor D. Los Milagros.

Roberta is married, is 68 years old and has 9 children. Roberta travels to all the markets in the region where she purchases cereals that she then resells in the Market of the Americas, a business she carries out during the harvest season. Additionally, Roberta also tends to a vegetable plantation.

Maria lives with her common-law spouse, is 32 years old and has 6 children. Maria runs a restaurant in her house and on Sundays she sells traditional food of the region.

Maruja also lives with her common-law spouse, she is 30 years old and has 2 daughters. She runs a bakery where she makes traditional breads and pastries. She sells her bakery products in the Santa Clara market.

Roberta, Maria and Maruja request a loan in the amounts of 600 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles respectively. The funds will be invested in the purchase of wheat, sweet peas, rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, and shortening.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Roberta, Maria y Maruja pertenecen al Banco Comunal Señor D. Los Milagros.

Roberta es casada, tiene 68 años y 9 hijos, Roberta viaja a las ferias D. la región donD. compra cereales que posteriormente venD. en el mercado D. las Américas, actividad que realiza en la época D. cosecha. Además Roberta se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras.

Por otro lado Maria es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 6 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en su casa, además los días domingos venD. comida típica D. la región.

Mientras que Maruja es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijas, Maruja tiene una panadería donD. elabora panes típicos y biscochos, sus productos lo venD. en el mercado Santa Clara.

Roberta, Maria y Maruja necesitan un préstamo D. 600 soles, 1400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada, arveja, arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina y manteca.

Los sueños D. Roberta, Maria y Maruja son construir su casa, mejorar sus negocios, ampliar su local e implementar más su panadería.

loans.use: Roberta, Maria and Maruja require a loan in the amount of 600 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles respectively. Funds will be invested in the purchase of  wheat, sweet peas, rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, and shortening.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio is a member of Senor De Los Milagros, a communal bank.

Rocio is a friendly person. She is 20 years old and she is a single mother of a 2 year old. Rocio sells products such as; vegetables in bulk and sells minor quantities at a local market. Her products are wanted in the city of Lima, and she is dependent on demand. Her products are transported by car and then distributed in bulk.

Rocio needs a loan of 1600 soles, money that will be invested in products.

Her ultimate dream is to own her house, study a major or career, better her business, and provide her daughter with schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Rocío es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.

Rocío es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hija de 2 años, Rocío vende verduras por mayor y menor en el mercado Nery García Zarate, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima, dependiendo de la demanda, sus productos los transporta con carro alquilado y luego distribuye por mayor y también vende por menor en un puesto del mercado.

Rocío necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de camote.

Los sueños de Rocío son tener una casa propia, estudiar una carrera, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a su hija.

loans.use: buy sweet potatoes

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is married with 2 children. Her children are currently in school. To support her children and husband, she has been selling candles, padlocks, and washing soaps to farmers who stay in their farmland. Her business is very lucrative, but due to low working capital some of her operation is very low. Linda wants to use her loan to buy more boxes of candles, washing soaps, and padlocks to increase inventory and expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Believers. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy boxes of candles, soaps, and padlocks

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Mr. G. B. is originally from Cantón Cojxac, in the town and department of Totonicapán. He works as a weaver and came to Asociación ASDIR in order to be able to expand the business he owns. He tells us that he has worked in weaving for over 20 years, making a traditional lightweight fabric. His brother started this business because he traveled frequently to the Panajachel department of Sololá and it occurred to him that he could market such a product there. G. B. worked for his brother for a while, but over time he thought of having his own shop. This was made possible through a loan from the BANDESA bank. He currently has four looms at home and two more in his worker’s houses. With the loan from ASDIR, he plans to buy two more looms and more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El es originario del Cantón Cojxac, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, quien labora como tejedor, acudió a la institución para poder ampliar el negocio que maneja. Nos manifiesta que desde hace 20 Años que empezó a laborar en la tejeduría, produciendo mantas laboreadas tipicas, el cual fue una iniciativa de su hermano quien viajaba mucho al municipio de Panajachel departamento de Sololá, le surgio la la idea que en este lugar se podia comercializar este producto, por una temporada estuvo laborando para su hermano, en el transcurso del tiempo pensó crear su propio taller, el cual le funcionó gracias a un crédito que el Banco que en sus siglas BANDESA le proporcionó y logro iniciar el negocio propio , actualmente tiene cuatro telares, dos instalados en casa de habitación y otros dos en casa de sus trabajadores. Con el crédito que ASDIR le va a proporcionar tiene la visión de implementar otros dos telares y compra de más materiales.

loans.use: Working capial for buying two new looms and materials

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis is 48 years old and the mother of 5 children. Four of her children are in school. Mavis loves sewing, especially for schoolchildren and adults as well. With her previous loan from Sinapi, she has been able to rent a store to enable her to secure her assets. She wants a loan to buy more sewing materials to expand her operation and also to start saving for her children’s education. Mavis is a member of the group called “Kamfo Yehowa,” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials like linen, cotton, polyester, buttons, etc

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her children are currently in school. Tomatoes are in high demand, as they are one of the main fruits used by almost all Ghanaians in the home for cooking. Florence wants to use her loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes to avoid price hikes as we enter the planting season and to increase inventory. She is a member of the group called Believers. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Mr. S. Lopéz is orginally from Guatemala City, the capital. He currently resides in Cantón Chotacaj, Totonicapán. He got his start by working for an auto body and painting shop in Guatemala City, but later married in Totonicapán, where he now lives. He opened his own auto body and paint workshop. He later noticed that the business didn’t have much income because there weren’t enough vehicles in the town, so he didn’t have that business for very long. He asked a friend in Quetzaltenango for a job in a shop that made metal structures. He worked there for 5 years, after which he took the initiative to open his own business. He opened a shop in the county of Cotacaj, where his products gained wide acceptance since there were none like them in the region. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to increase his work on metallic roofs (synthetic ball courts, salons, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Originario de la Ciudad Capital, actualmente con residencia en el Cantón Chotacaj, Totonicapán, Inicialmente laboraba para una empresa de Enderezado y Pintura de vehículo en su ciudad natal, luego contrajo matrimonio en el municipio de Totonicapán donde actualmente reside, en donde instaló un local para el enderezado y pintura de vehículo pero tiempo más adelante observó que en el lugar el negocio no tenía mucho ingreso porque la cantidad de vehículos no era suficiente, no muy tarde dejó este negocio. Pidió trabajo a un amigo en Quetzaltenango, Guatemala que laboraba en estructuras metálicas donde laboro 5 años, después tuvo la iniciativa de emprender su propio negocio, instaló su local de trabajo en el cantón chotacaj, donde este producto tuvo una aceptación ya que la misma no existía en el medio . Con el crédito que solicita pretende aumentar su trabajo en techos metálicos (canchas Sintéticas, Salones etc.).

loans.use: Working capital to be able to buy metalwork materials

loans.name: Comite Primavera Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women the energy and motivation to reach success.

The Comite Primavera (Spring Group) is today in its sixth cycle. All the members of the group are very responsible and punctual with their payments.

Among the businesses these ladies run are: sewing shops, grocery stores, milk sales, fruits, vegetables, drinks, clothing, cheese and others. The money provided by the credit will be used to purchase sugar, rice, fruits, vegetables, drinks and fabrics.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, fruits, vegetables, drinks and fabrics.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Born on August 5, 1966 in Cotonou in the economic capital of Benin, Littoral County, Ms. Josephine B. is married and the mother of 4 children. She is trained as a nurse and works at Bethesda, a Christian health care center in Cotonou, however she also sells various consumables that she purchases in Togo and Nigeria. In the beginning, she delivered her products to bureaucrats, going from office to office in her free time. Now she has a shop which she uses both to store her goods and as a sales point. She is requesting her first loan from Alidé and intends to use it to restock and diversify her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 05 Août 1966 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN dans le département du Littoral, dame B. Josephine est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Infirmière de profession et travaillant à Béthesda, un centre de santé chrétien de Cotonou, elle exerce parallèlement à cette profession, la vente de divers produits de consommation courante qu'elle achète au Togo et au Nigéria. Initialement, elle livrait ses produits aux fonctionnaires en passant de bureau en bureau à ses heures libres. Elle dispose aujourd'hui d'une boutique qui lui sert à la fois de magasin de stockage et de point de vente. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à ALIDé en vu de s'approvisionner et de diversifier son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of ten 10-kilogram bags of rice, 2 cartons of spaghetti, a carton of tinned food, and 50 liters of vegetable oil

Achat de 10 sacs de 10 kg de riz, de 02 cartons de spaguetti, un carton de boîte de conserve et 50litres d'huile végétale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix Alonso R. started working at a very young age in a service station where he stayed for 15 years. His wife worked as a school teacher. With the passage of time Felix was tired of being an employee and decided to start his own business. He bought a mini bus and he works as the driver. His wife is now retired.

Felix is married and has three daughters. He is so proud to have provided his daughters with a good education because today all three are excellent professionals. He also provided them with comfort and was able to fulfill all their necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Félix Alonso Ramírez empezó a trabajar desde muy joven en una estación de servicio y permaneció por quince años trabajando en el mismo lugar. Al mismo tiempo, su esposa trabajaba como maestra en una escuela. Con el correr de los años Félix se canso de ser un empleado y decidió comenzar un emprendimiento, compró un ómnibus y trabaja como chofer. Actualmente su esposa ya es jubilada.

Félix está casado y tiene tres hijas. El se enorgullece de haberle brindado a sus hijas buena educación, porque hoy día las tres son excelentes profesionales. También les brindo comodidad y pudo satisfacer todas sus necesidades.

loans.use: Maintenance repairs for his mini bus.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo is 48 years old and his wife Teodolina is 49. The couple has two children.

Due to the lack of employment in Paraguay many people emigrate to neighbouring countries, like Argentina. With the goal of finding a better job, Justo and his wife decided to try their luck and travelled to Argentina. There they stayed 10 years. Justo worked as a labourer and his wife worked as a house maid. But after those 10 years they decided to return to Paraguay with a business idea and the wish to invest in their home country.

Today the couple owns a bar where people can come and relax, have a few drinks and a meal. The bar has given them the opportunity to provide their children with an education and the nutrition they need. Thanks to their efforts and good management skills, Justo and his wife see their business in a state of constant growth.

The funds that are requested will be invested in the purchase of drinks, flour, meats, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Justo tiene 48 años de edad y su esposa la señora Teodolina 49. La pareja tiene dos hijos.

Debido a la escasez de fuentes de trabajo en Paraguay muchas personas emigran a países vecinos como la Argentina. Con el fin de buscar mejores oportunidades laborales, Justo y su esposa decidieron probar suerte y viajaron a la Argentina. Allí permanecieron por 10 años; Justo trabajando como constructor y su esposa como empleada domestica. Luego de 10 anos decidieron volver al Paraguay con ideas emprendedoras y con ganas de invertir en su país.

Actualmente la pareja es dueña de un bar donde las personas van a relajarse y a tomar unos tragos o comer algo. El bar les dio la oportunidad de otorgarles educación a sus hijos y de brindarle las comodidades necesarias. Gracias al esfuerzo y buena gestión del Sr. Justo y su esposa, el negocio sigue en constante crecimiento.

El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de bebidas, harina, carne, huevo, leche, azúcar.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, wine, beer, flour, meats, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is an elderly woman, and she fries and sells ripe plantains and boiled beans to schoolchildren and the neighbors. She has 3 children and only 1 of them is currently in school. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to buy more plantains, beans, and vegetable oil to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Maranatha. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy beans, ripe plantains, vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is a widow with 7 children. She has sold soft drinks and grocery products like biscuits, candies, bread, etc for 3 years now. She used to be a baker but was advised by medical doctors to stop baking because of the heat. To enable her to earn a living, she started trading in soft drinks and some grocery products. She wants to use the loan to buy more crates of soft drinks and grocery products to expand her operation. Adwoa is a member of the group called Maranatha. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy crates of soft drinks and some grocery products

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 54 years old and a divorced mother with 1 child. She has been selling household cooking wares for the past 8 years by hawking. Currently she wants to add traveling bags and ladies’ hang bags to enable her to increase her income to take care of her child. She wants to use her loan to buy more bags, saucepans, and plastic containers to increase inventory. She is a member of the group called Bethel. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans, bags, and plastic ice containers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 59 years old and the mother of 2 kids and 4 grandchildren whom she is taking care of. She has operated a grocery store in her neighborhood for 23 years now. Mary wants to buy additional varieties of products like sanitary towels, tampons, pampers, babies’ soaps, and other toiletries. She therefore wants to use her loan to buy more products to expand her operations. Mary is a member of the group called Elizabeth. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco started out as an assistant in a repair and body shop. That's how he acquired his knowledge in the field. A few years later he decided to open his own garage with the help of his brother.

Francisco is 35 years of age and has been married for eight years to Cristina del Rocio Figueredo who is 29 years old. The couple has a 4-year old daughter. Cristina has always dreamed of being a teacher. So when they got married Francisco paid for Cristina's university studies to help her realize her dream. Today is a teacher in a school, and she also supports the family with another source of income.

The two are hard working people and they are building their own house. The funds of the credit requested will be invested in building materials and to pay for labour in the completion of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco empezó a trabajar como asistente en un taller de chapería y pintura. Es ahí donde adquirió conocimientos en el rubro. Unos años después decidió abrir su propio taller con la ayuda de su hermano.

Francisco tiene 35 años de edad está casado hace 8 años con la Sra. Cristina del Rocío Figueredo de 29 años de edad, la pareja tiene una hija de 4 años. Cristina siempre soñó con ser docente, entonces cuando la pareja se caso, Francisco pago los estudios universitarios de Cristina para ayudarla a realizar su sueno. Actualmente ella es profesora en una escuela, y así también es otra fuente de ingresos para la familia.

Los dos son personas muy trabajadoras que están construyendo su casa propia. Es por eso que el dinero del crédito solicitado será invertido en la materiales y mano de obra para la finalización de su casa.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as bricks, cements, sand, and paint.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.es:
Con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida un grupo de señoras de la localidad Potrero en la ciudad de Carepegua decidió informarse acerca del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya.

Motivadas por un futuro mejor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante formaron un comité mediante el cual ellas puedan recibir créditos para así tener capital para invertir y generar más dinero mediante la inversión de sus préstamos en su actividades comerciales.

Hace exactamente 26 meses se creó el comité y hoy día se encuentran en el sexto ciclo. Durante este tiempo los miembros del comité aprendieron a ser más responsables y puntuales con sus pagos, a invertir de manera eficaz, y sobre todo a trabajar en grupo.

Cada miembro se dedica a una actividad diferente, pero la mayoría se dedica a las artesanías. Otras también son tejedoras. Las señoras necesitan el crédito para poder comprar la materia prima para continuar con la producción de artesanías y tejidos. Los materiales que necesitan son hilo, aguja, crochet etc.

loans.use: compra de hilos, agujas, telas, entre otros.

loans.name: Lealtad Group

texts.es:
The communal bank ‘El Banco Comunal Lealtad” is a new and just began its second cycle with twenty members. The members say that the communal bank not only gives them loans, but also educates them on subjects that help them in their businesses and home.

The members have different types of businesses, like the sale of meat, clothes, vegetables, crafts, tubers (potato-like vegetables), groceries, drinks and firewood.

The members need different amounts of loans. Some need 300 Soles, some need 600 Soles and others need 900 Soles. 9,450 Soles. All of the amounts add up to 9,450 Soles.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of flour, lard, wool, rice, sugar, milk, squash, tomatoes, onions, small animals, wheat, corn, barley, polo shirts, sweaters, soft drinks and firewood.

The dreams of the members are to have their own house, improve their businesses and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

El Banco Comunal Lealtad es un Banco joven que inicia su segundo ciclo con 20 socias. Las socias mencionan que en su Banco Comunal no solo reciben prestamos sino también las capacitan en temas que les ayuda en sus negocios y hogar.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. carne, ropa, verduras, artesanías, tubérculos, abarrotes, bebidas, leña.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,450 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra harina, manteca, lana, arroz, azúcar, leche, zapallo, tomate, cebolla, animales menores, trigo, cebada, maíz, polos, chompas, gaseosas y leña.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, mejorar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use:
flour, lard, wool, rice,
sugar, milk, squash, tomatoes, onions, small animals, wheat, corn, barley,
polo shirts, sweaters, soft drinks, and firewood

loans.name: Chaska Lucero Group

texts.es:
Chaska Lucero is a communal bank that just opened with 17 associates. The associates are very content with receiving a loan that has helped them increase their business.

The associates do different sales, such as clothes, cereal, wheat, corn, soft drinks, natural medicine, tomatoes, onion, shoes, cosmetics, rice, sugar, noodles, oranges, bananas and other fruits.

The associates need different methods of loans. Some loans start at 300 soles and go up to 9900 soles.

Their ultimate dream is to increase their business, proper capital and proviD. their children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

El Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero es un Banco que recién inicia con 17 socias. Las socias están contentas D. recibir un préstamo que les ayudara para implementar más sus negocios.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. ropa, cereales, frutas, bebidas, mercería, mediciN. natural, cosméticos, zapatos, comida y artesanía en telar.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,900 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra polos, pantalones, chompas, trigo, cebada, maíz, gaseosas, mediciN. natural, tomate, cebolla, zapatos, cosméticos, arroz, azúcar, fideo, naranja, manzaN. y plátano.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar su negocio, tener capital propio, brindar uN. bueN. educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: shirts, pants, wheat, barley, corn, sodas, natural medicines, tomatoes, onions, shoes, cosmetics, rice, sugar, noodles, oranges, apples, plantains

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo started his business to help his parents when he was young and wanted an income to support himself and help with the maintenance of his brothers and sisters. He started 25 years ago selling popsicles and ice cream sandwiches. Later he learned to make them when he bought his first freezer. With this business he can now support himself, his wife and their 3 children ages 10, 4 and 2 years.

Now he needs a loan of $400, which will be repaid in 6 months, to repair his freezer and buy raw materials. With your help he will continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosendo inició el negocio para ayudar a sus padres cuando era joven ya que deseaba tener un ingreso para mantenerse y ayudar a la manutencion de sus hermanos. Comenzó hace 25 años vendiendo paletas de hielo en con una caja de galletas y posteriormente aprendio a hacerleas comprando su primer congelador. Ahora con este negoico puede mantener y sacar adelante a su mujer y sus 3 hijos de 10, 4 y 2 años.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para reparar su congelar y comprar materia prima. Con tu ayuda el seguira con su negocio.

loans.use: To repair his freezer and buy materials for making frozen confections.

loans.name: Jose Patrocinio

texts.es:
Jose started his business when his brother, due to the demands of his work, asked that he work with him independently 12 years ago. He sought his own business where he could earn more money and also give good service to the clients. Jose worked as an employee but did not earn very much since they only paid him 50% of what he repaired. That was when he decided to take out a loan to go into the mechanic business in general. He is married and has 3 children ages 14, 11 and 6 years.

He needs a loan of $600 that will be repaid in 6 months to buy a scanner to process the work more quickly, to buy repair parts and to increase his inventory. With your aid this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Jose inició el negocio, cuando su hermano debido a la demanda del trabajo le pidio que trabajara con el indpendientemente, hace 12 años. El buscaba un trabajo propio y en donde pudiera ganar mas dinero y asi dar buen servicio a los clientes; el trabajaba como empleado, no ganaba muy bien ya que solo le pagaba el 50% de lo que reparaba, y fue cuando decidimos sacar credito para ir habilitanto el negocio de mecanica en general. El esta casado y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 6 años.

El necesita un prestamo por US$600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un scanner para sacar el trabajo mas rapido, asi como para comprar refacciones y elevar su inventario. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: To buy tools and parts for his mechanic business.

loans.name: Amelia's Group

texts.es:
This borrower's group has 15 members who are hard-working women from the San Miguel district in the city of Caacupé. The group is now in the 4th cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) program and to date they have an average line of credit of 746.000 gs per member.

The group was created because Amelia learned about the project through an ad in the local media and came to our office where she was given all of the information on the Mujeres Emprendedoras group at Fundación Paraguaya.

Amelia was very quickly able to assemble 15 women, which is the minimum number of members required to form a group, and after going through the training sessions she established this group of working women who have hopes to progress. Today it is obvious that the women are very happy to be a part of her group and that the group's members all come from the same district.

The group's main goal is to capitalize on their internal savings as soon as possible through their businesses that provide income such as making food, running raffles and other businesses. This will enable them to have extra money to pay their dues in case anything sudden happens that will prevent them from paying.

They will invest the loans that they receive in the purchase of products to make chipas (local food that is very commonly eaten in Paraguay) such as starch, oil, cheese and also to purchase, herbs, sugar, soft drinks and another group of them who sell clothing need the loans to purchase used clothing wholesale because this enables them to get lower prices.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Miguel de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo se encuentra actualmente en el 4to. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprendedoras, y a la fecha todas manejan una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 746.000 por cada integrante.

El comité fue formado gracias a que la señora Amelia tuvo conocimiento del proyecto a través de una publicidad en uno de los medios locales y se acerco a la oficina, dónde recibió toda la información acerca del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedaras de la Fundación Paraguaya.

En poco tiempo la señora Amelia llego a juntar a las 15 señoras, que es el mínimo de integrantes requerido para formar el comité; así es como luego de las reuniones de capacitación se formaliza este grupo de hermosas señoras trabajadoras y deseosas de progresar. Hoy día manifiestan que están muy contentas de ser parte de su grupo además de que el mismo está formado por vecinas del mismo barrio.

El principal objetivo de este grupo es la de capitalizar en la brevedad posible sus ahorros interno a través de actividades que genere ganancias como ser feria de comida, rifas (sorteos) entre otras actividades, esto les permitirá tener un extra para pagar las cuotas en caso de surgir algún imprevisto y que imposibilite pagar la cuota.

Los préstamos que recibieran desean invertirlo en la compra de productos para la elaboración de chipas (comida típica muy consumida en Paraguay) como ser almidón, aceite, queso, como así también para la compra de yerba, azúcar, gaseosas, otro grupo de señora que se dedican a la venta de ropa necesitan el crédito para la compra de ropas usadas en forma mayorista ya que esto les permite obtener un precio mas bajo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as sugar, herbs, starch, vegetable oil, cheese, milk, cookies, meet, soft drinks, beers, all types of drinks and also  to purchase clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
Rosa started her business to support her husband with the economy of the house and to pay for the education of her son, who is 15 years old. She decided to open a grocery store because when she lived in another area she helped a friend with her business. When she moved, she decided to open a store in her home, now that she knew it was a good business.

She requests a loan of $300, which will be repaid in 3 months, to invest in merchandise and grow her business. With your support her business will be able to grow.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo en la economia de la casa y a pagar los estudios de su hijo, quien tiene 15 años. Ella decidio abrir una tienda de abarrotes debido a que cuando vivia en otra colonia le ayudaba a una amiga con el negocio y asi que cuando se cambio decidio abrir la tienda su domicilio, ya que sabia que era un buen negocio.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para invertir en mercancia y agrandar su negocio. Con tua apoyo su negocio podra crecer.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Enedelia

texts.es:
Enedelia and her husband lived in Tamaulipas. They decided to come and live in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon and start their grocery store, which they have now had for 20 years, to support their children with the expenses of school and to offer them a better quality of life. They have 10 children, of which 8 are married and only 2 live with them: a girl of 14 years and a boy of 17 years, who occasionally help with the business.

She wants to diversify her business and now requests a loan of $1175, which will be repaid in 6 months, to be able to invest in merchandise and grow her business. She wants to be able to sell clothes and shoes there as well. With your help Enedelia will be able to accomplish this.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Enedelia y su esposo vivian en Tamaulipas, decidieron venir a vivir a Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, e iniciaron su tienda de abarrotes, con el cual tienen 20 años, para apoyar a sus hijos en los gastos de la escuela y para brindarles mejor calidad de vida. Ellos tienen 10 hijos de los cuales 8 estan casados y solo 2 vivien copn ellos una mujer de 14 años y un hombre de 17 años, quienes ocasionalmente ayudan en el negocio.

Ella desea diversificar su negocio ahora solicita un prestamo por US $1175 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertir en mercancia y agrandar su negocio, porque quiere tener venta de ropa y zapatos ahí mismo. con tu ayuda Enedelia podra lograrlo.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for sale in her store.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilda is married and has 3 children. She owns a nursery where she sells a variety of plants, fertilizers, etc. Her business is located in a very busy area in town in the barrio called General Diaz in the city of Caacupe.

Matilda tells us that beside her nursery she also has a small store where she sells refreshments, but her nursery is the one that provides her with the most income and this is the type of business she really likes.

With this loan, she will be able to purchase a whole lot of diferent types of plants and fertilizers, seeds and hoses, bags, and flowerpots, etc.

Her main clients are the vendors who purchase at wholesale to later sell them at a profit. Her clients are from different cities such as San Bernardino, Asuncion, San Lorenzo and Ciudad del Este. They travel from far away to purchase her beautiful plants.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde, es una señora casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a las venta de plantas, abonos, macetas, entre otros productos para el jardín, su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los barrios mas concurrido y con mucho movimiento de gente que es el barrio Gral. Díaz de la ciudad de Caacupé.

Matilde comenta, que aparte de la venta de planta también tiene, una pequeña despensa dónde vende preferentemente bebidas heladas, pero aún así el negocio que mayor ingreso le genera es el de la venta de plantas además de que es la que más le gusta.

Con el crédito que solicita ella podrá comprar gran cantidad de plantas de distintas variedades también abonos, semillas y accesorios como mangueras, bolsas, macetas, entre otros artículos.

Sus principales cliente son los comerciantes que comprar al por mayor para luego venderlos nuevamente en sus negocios o de forma ambulante. Sus clientes son de distintas ciudades, que viajan varias horas para llegar hasta ella y comprar sus bellas plantas, algunas de estas ciudades son San Bernardino, Asunción, San Lorenzo, Ciudad del Este.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plants flowerpots and fertilizers

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar is a person who since very young has been dedicated to business. He started as as assistant to a goldsmith, but his boss went broke and he saw the need to seek another form of earning a living. Since his mother had a clothes business in an open-air market he decided to dedicate himself full time to this position. He has already more than 6 years selling women’s sandals, a business that permits him to support himself and to settle the expenses of his house and his small son of 11 months.

He needs a loan of $600, that will be repaid in 3 months, to repair his car, since it needs maintenance and is one of his main tools of work. He uses it to transport the merchandise to the markets. With your aid Gaspar can continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Gaspar es una persona Q. desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio el empezó de ayudante de orfebrería, pero su patrón quebró y se vio en la necesidad de buscar otra forma de ganase la vida, por medio de su mama Q. tenia un negocio de ropa en tianguis se decidió por meterse de lleno a este oficio el tiene ya mas de 6 años dedicado ala venta de sandalias para dama, negocio Q. le permite mantenerse y solventar los gastos de su casa y su peQ.ño hijo de 11 meses.

El necesita un prestamo por US $600 Q. pagara en 3 meses para reparar su auto ya Q. necesita mantenimiento y es una de sus principales herramienta de trabajo, ya Q. en este traslada la mercancia a los mercados. Con tu ayuda Gaspar seguira haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To repair his car, which he uses to transport merchandise to the markets.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa started her business to help her family to get ahead, since her husband’s salary was not sufficient, what with the birth of the children, and so they decided to become independent. They began their business 20 years ago. Her husband is a contractor and he saw an area of opportunity in the sale of sponges for construction, which he sells to the builders and hardware stores. They have 4 children ages 20, 19, 17 and 15 years. The oldest of them helps in the business.

She needs a loan of $775, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy a large quantity of sponges, and in this way to be able to supply more clients. With your support her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luisa inició el negocio para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba, con el nacimiento de los hijos y de ahí se decidieron hacerse independientes. Comenzaron su negocio hace 20 años, su esposo es contratista y vio una area de oportuinidad en la venta de esponja para las construcciones, la cual venden a las constructoras y ferreterias. Ellos tienen 4 hijos de 20, 19, 17 y 15 años. El mayor de ellos les ayuda en el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una cantidad grande de esponja, y asi poder surtir a mas clientes. Con tu apoyo su negocio crecera.

loans.use: To buy sponges in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza started her business to help her husband with the family expenses, since they needed to pay for the education of their children and buy their own house, because they wanted to leave a legacy to their children. She started her business 8 years ago. The idea came to her that she lived on a street with many businesses who purchased items in her husband's store and wanted food for sale. This made her decide to start a business in that location. She started a market for selling food.

She needs a loan of $600, which will be repaid in 6 months, to remodel her business and in this way achieve growth.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenza inició el negocio para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de su familia ya que necesitaban solventar los estudios de sus hijos y comprar una casa propia, porque deseaban dejarle un patrimonio a sus 3 hijos. Comenzó hace 8 años su negocio, le surgio la idea ya que vive en una avenida y hay muchos negocios a su alrededor, los cuales compran en la tienda de su esposo, y le pedian comida en venta por loq ue decidio poner un negocio de este giro, ademas de instalarse en un mercado con la venta de comida.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio y asi logar su crecimiento.

loans.use: To remodel her food sale business.

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es:
Rosa Patricia is a young 29 year old mom of 2 kids aged 10 and 13 years. She lives with her family in the area of Laureles Sur in the city of Managua. She is married and her husband works as a builder, working for himself. Most of the time he out of the house looking for contracts to take on in order to earn the income he needs, so that together with Rosa Patricia, they may be able to support their family.

Rosa works as a supervisor in a factory, a position she managed to get with a great deal of hard work and dedication. Among her many dreams, she wishes to provide her children with an education, to offer them a better quality of life, and she would also like to renovate their home. For this reason she requests a loan, and with it she will be able to finish the renovation construction to the front of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Patricia es una joven madre de 29 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 13 años. Habita junto a su familia en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua. Es casada, su esposo se dedica al oficio de albañilería, trabaja por cuenta propia, la mayor parte del tiempo está fuera de su casa en busca de trabajo que le dé los ingresos necesarios para que junto a Rosa Patricia puedan dar el sustento a su familia. Rosa trabaja como supervisora en una zona franca, puesto que logró obtener con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Entre sus sueños está el poder darle educación a sus hijos, ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida, y también desea poder mejorar su hogar, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, terminará de construir la pared frontal de su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To complete renovation construction to the front of their house.

loans.name: Isauro

texts.es:
Isauro started his business because of the family tradition. Since his entire family has been in this business, this spurred him to start in the business also. For 15 years he has had a butcher shop and he also enjoys preparing braised pork. He started in Cadereyta, when on trying some braised pork he noted that the flavor and preparation were not like in his home town. Knowing how to prepare them better, he decided to start his business in that town.

He needs a loan of $775, which will be repaid in 6 months, to improve his location and maintain his van.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Isauro inició el negocio por tradicion familiar, puesto que toda su familia se dedican a eso para el fue un estimulo para iniciarse en el negocio, hace 15 años tenia una carniceria y despues le gusto la preparacion de las carnitas.
