Comenzó en Cadereyta, cuando al probar unas carnitas noto que el sabor y la elaboracion no eran como en su ciudad natal, por lo que al saber elaboralas decidio inicar su negocio de este giro.

El necesita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para mejorar el local y mantenimiento de la camioneta.

loans.use: To remodel his butcher shop and repair his van.

loans.name: Celenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Celenia is 46 years old, she is single and she works as a house maid in order to take care of her family. She lives in the region of Laureles Norte in Managua. She has two sons aged 16 and 14 years old, to whom she hopes to provide an education and she is willing to keep working hard so that they may grow up to be upstanding citizens in the community. The father of the young boys supports them by providing the family with a monthly meal allowance, and she manages to spare some portion of her income for home improvements.

With the previous loans she has received she has been able to make improvements to their house, and with this loan she hopes to replace part of the roofing before the winter and before water begins to seep into their home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Celenia tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y trabaja como doméstica para poer sacar adelante a su familia. Habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Tiene 2 hijos varones de 16 y 14 años, a los cuales espera poder darles educación y seguir luchando para que sean hombres de bien para la sociedad. El padre de los muchachos le ayuda con una pensión alimenticia mensual, y ella ocupa parte de su salario mensual para tratar de mejorar las condiciones de infraestructura de su casa de habitación. Con los créditos anteriores ha podido mejorar su casa poco a poco, y con este crédito espera poder cambiar parte del techo de su vivienda, ya que con el invierno se le deteriora más y el agua penetra en su vivienda

loans.use: To replace the tiles on the roof of her house.

loans.name: Comité Koe´ju Group

texts.es:
This committee is composed of 15 hard working women who the majority are business women that sell yucca breads. The group is currently in the fifth stage of their program for women. The union of this committee is largely thanks to the efforts of Gloria C. who sought out each of these women in their homes and invited them to come to partake in an information session in their home.

This is how the Koe'ju Committee was born, in our second aboriginal language Guarani the name means "Sunrise". This committee is composed of 15 women of which 7 sell yucca breads (a traditional food in Paraguay widely popular and resembling cheese bread). Three of the women run grocery stores and the others sell clothing. They are all neighbours in the Kennedy region in the city of Caaupe. One of the virtues of this committee is the interest and loyalty in the rules and regulations of the program, and in the timeliness of the monthly payments. These women also hold a capital savings thanks to the work they carry out every weekend in the markets, for special events, sporting events, and any other occassion.

All of the members receive an equal sum of money and they will invest it in the purchase of ingredients and merchandise for their sales. The committee's objective for the short term is to improve the image of the region by keeping the public patios clean and by painting the fences along the streets and also to remodel the small plaza, in need of repair and repainting. In addition, the play structures need to be repaired so that the children might have their recreational area to play in safely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras que en su mayoría son comerciantes, la mayoría de ellas se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas, actualmente el grupo ya está en su 5to. ciclo del programa comité de mujeres. La unión de este comité se debió en gran parte por la buena predisposición de la señora Gloria C. quien fue la buscó a cada señora de sus casas y las invitó para la reunión de información que se realizó en su casa.

Así nace el Comité Koe`ju, que en nuestro segundo idioma nativo el Guaraní significa Amanecer. Este comité está integrado por 15 señoras de las cuales 7 se dedican a la venta de chipas (comida típica del Paraguay muy consumida parecida a un pan con queso), 3 poseen despensas y las otras se dedican a la venta de ropas. Todas son vecinas del barrio Kennedy de la ciudad de Caaupé, una de las virtudes de este comité es el interés y el cumplimiento de las normas y reglamento del programa, además de la puntualidad en los pagos de sus cuotas. Estas mujeres poseen además un interesante ahorro de dinero gracias a las actividades que realizan cada fin de semana como ferias de comidas, rifas, torneos deportivos, entre otras actividades.

Todas las integrantes reciben un promedio de gs. 580.000 y lo invierten para la compra de insumos y mercaderías para sus ventas. El comité tiene como objetivo a corto plazo la de mejorar la imagen del barrio con la limpieza de los patios baldíos, veredas y pintar los cordones de las calles al igual que embellecer la pequeña plaza del barrio que necesita pintura y reparación de los juegos para que sus hijos tengan un lugar donde recrearse sanamente y fuera de peligros.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, meats, eggs, milk, cookies, soft drinks, starch, cheese, vegetable oil, and to purchase clothing for adults and children such as shorts, t-shirts, nylons, and blouses.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina started her business by her own initiative out of enjoyment of the profession and economic necessity when she needed to contribute to the expenses of the house and education of the children and also for her own personal self-improvement. She began 10 years ago with the help of a friend who helped her by teaching her to manicure and cut and style hair. Later she became independent.

She needs a loan of $675, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy materials to make new hairstyles and a variety of dyes and cosmetic products (lipstick, blush, foundation, etc.)

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermina inició el negocio por iniciativa propia ademas de gusto por esa profesion y necesidad economica ya que necesitaba contribuir con los gastos de la casa, educacion para los niños y ademas por superacion personal. Comenzó hace 10 años con el apoyo de una amiga que la ayudo a iniciarse enseñandole desde manicure hasta cortes y peinados y posteriormente se independizo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US$675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material para hacer nuevos cortes de cabello, variedad de tintes y productos cosmeticos ( labial, rubor, maquillaje, etc.)

loans.use: To buy materials for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Claudia Liliana

texts.es:
Claudia started her business because of her family tradition and her desire to prosper. She wanted to help her partner with the education costs of their children and to live better. She began her business 2 years ago with her grocery store, selling small quantities of products because her business was small, but little by little her efforts have been able to make it grow.

She requests a loan of $600 which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise and offer a greater variety of merchandise. With your help her business will prosper and grow in sales.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia inició el negocio por tradicion familiar y por el deseo de prosperar . Ella deseaba ayudar a su pareja en los gastos de la educacion de sus hijos y para vivir mejor. Comenzó su negocio hace 2 años con su tienda de abarrotes, vendiendo muy poca cantidad de productos, ya que su negocio era pequeño, pero poco a poco a base de esfuerzo a podio hacerlo crecer .

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y ofrecer mas surtido de mercancia. Con tu ayuda su negocio prosperara y aumentaran las ventas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Welmher

texts.es:
Welmher’s splendid art has allowed him to be the protagonist of his own development. He is a talented young man who is 20 years old and who in his free time weaves beautiful ponchos, chuspas (pouches) and excellent handcrafted decorative ornaments. He inherited this beautiful work from his loving parents who patiently instilled in him their knowledge. Welmher, not only excels in this work, he is also an excellent student in a prestigious university in the city of Juliaca. Thanks to his adeptness at weaving he can cover his personal expenses as well as his school expenses. This enterprising young man’s wish is to have more capital to invest in raw materials to continue diligently working as he has been.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Su esplendoroso arte le está permitiendo ser protagonista de su propio desarrollo a Welmher, joven talentoso de 20 años de edad, quien en sus horas libres se dedica a tejer hermosos ponchos, chuspas y excelentes adornos decorativos en forma artesanal. Este bello trabajo lo heredó de sus queridos padres quienes supieron inculcarle pacientemente sus conocimientos.Welmher, no sólo se destaca en este trabajo, si no que es un excelente estudiante de una prestigiosa universidad de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a su destreza para el arte D. tejido puede cubrir sus gastos personales y sobre todo los gastos de sus estudios superiores.El deseo de este emprendedor joven es contar con mayor capital para invertir en materia prima y seguir trabajando con diligencia como hasta ahora lo viene haciendo.

loans.use: Additional capital to make a greater quantity of weavings.

loans.name: Dora Patricia

texts.es:
Dora started her business because at the time her husband was left without a job and she had always liked automotive trends. She needed to help her husband to pay for the maintenance of their children, receipts for services and school. She began over 20 years ago when a relative invited them to join him in business because her husband had knowledge of mechanics. She took advantage of the opportunity to begin buying cars and selling the motors. She has 3 children: Abelardo age 21, Victor Manuel 18 and Ana Patricia 15 years. Abelardo, the oldest, helps in the business.

She needs a loan of $1175, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy 2 cars in order to remove the motors. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Dora inició el negocio ya que en ese tiempo su esposo se quedo sin empleo y siempre le ha gustado el giro automotriz. Ella necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con el pago de la manutencion de sus hijos,recibos de servicios y escuela. Comenzó hace mas de 20 años un familiar los invito a unirse al negocio ya que su esposo tiene conocimientos de mecanica, aprovecho para empezar a comprar carros y venderlos los motores. Ella tiene 3 hijos: Abelardo de 21, Victor Manuel 18 y Ana Patricia de 15 años. Abelardo el mas grande ayuda en el negocio.

Ella neceita un prestamo por US $ 1175 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar 2 carros para sacar los motores. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: To buy 2 cars to remove the motors for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started her business because of economic necessity when her husband did not have stable work, by her own account. She began more than 8 years ago selling shoes by catalog to her friends and later worked with a consignment shoe store. She is married and has 2 children: Aidee, 12 years and Jose Juan, age 7 years.

She needs a loan of $100, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy general merchandise. With your help her business will continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel inició el negocio por necesidad economica ya que su esposo no tenia trabajo estable, solo por su cuenta; por lo que comenzó hace mas de 8 años vendiendo zapatos por catalogo con sus amistades y despues trabajo con una zapateria a consignacion.Ella esta casada y tiene 2 hijos Aidee 12 años y Jose Juan de 7 años.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $100 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia general.Con tu ayuda su negocio seguira creciendo.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia started her business because her husband did not have work and the pension was not sufficient to pay for services and the maintenance of her children. She started her business more than 10 years ago, selling natural products and cosmetics to friends and neighbors, increasing her list of clients little by little.

She needs a loan of $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your help her business will be able to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia inició el negocio ya que su esposo no tenia empleo y la pension no le alcanza para el pago de los servicios y la manutencion de sus hijos. Comenzó su negocio hace mas de 10 años vendiendo productos naturales y cosmeticos con amistades y vecinas, incrementado su cartera de clientes poco a poco.

Ella neceita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda su negocio podra prosperar.

loans.use: To buy natural products and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
We find Dina in the company of her neighbors, zealously knitting lovely items such as sweaters, chullos (traditional Peruvian hat) and caps. This young 24-year old woman is an expert at this beautiful art. Since she was a child, she demonstrated an affinity for this craft and for this reason she currently counts on numerous orders. She has been able to become independent and dream for her future. However, she has a problem in that she does not have enough raw materials (yarn) to continue her wonderful work. Dina’s wish is to obtain a loan to purchase a greater quantity of raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a Dina en compañía de sus vecinas, tejiendo afanosamente sus hermosas prendas de vestir (chompas, chullos y gorras), esta joven de 24 años de edad es una experta en este bello arte. Desde muy niña demostró tener cualidad para el tejido, es por ello que actualmente cuenta con innumerables solicitudes, que le permitieron independizarse y velar por su futuro, pero tiene un problema no posee suficiente materia prima (lana) para seguir elaborando sus bellos trabajos.El deseo de Dina es obtener un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a greater quantity of raw material.

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín is a responsible father who, seeing the strategic location where his home was located, decided to outfit it so he could open a small concession stand. He offers delicious cakes, sodas, hamburgers, juices and yogurts. He prepares his items personally for his regular and demanding customers. Thanks to this business which he started more than four years ago, and the income earned by his dear wife at her restaurant, they maintain their home and provide an education for their child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Efraín es un padre muy responsable, observando el lugar estratégico en que está ubicado su domicilio decidió aprovechar y adecuarlo para abrir un pequeño snack en donde ofrece deliciosas tortas, gaseosas, hamburguesas, jugos y, yogures. Que personalmente prepara para sus asiduos y exigentes clientes.Gracias a este negocio que emprendió hace más de 4 años y a los ingresos que obtiene su querida esposa en su restaurante mantienen su hogar y le otorgan educación a su pequeño.

loans.use: Increase of capital to make improvements to work area.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca started her business because her husband was unemployed at that time and she needed to obtain an income in order to pay the household expenses. She began selling cosmetics more than 2 years ago to family and neighbors. She has 2 sons; Osvaldo and Pedro, ages 17 and 12 years.

She requests a loan of $250 with will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your help she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca inició el negocio ya que su esposo en ese tiempo estaba desempleado y necesitaba obtener un ingreso para solventar los gastos de la casa.Comenzó hace mas de 2 años vendiendo cosmeticos con familiares y vecinos. Ella tiene 2 hijos Osvaldo y Pedro de 17 y 12 años.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is a very active and creative woman who, since taking control of her own life, has been involved in different activities to help her mother provide an education for her four beloved brothers. Maritza dedicates herself to making beautiful overalls, shirts and shorts on order, with the help of her mother Julia. In addition to this endeavor, she works providing mobile phone calls to Juliaca residents. With these two activities, she is managing to support herself financially as well as her mother who is currently in fragile health.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza, es una mujer muy activa y creativa, desde que tomó las riendas de su vida se desenvolvió en diferentes actividades para generar sus ingresos y poder apoyar a su madre en la educación de sus 4 amados hermanos.Maritza con apoyo de su querida madre Julia, se dedica a confeccionar hermosos buzos, camisetas y bermudas por pedidos, adicionalmente a esta labor trabaja brindando llamadas móviles a la población Juliaqueña. Con estas dos actividades está logrando apoyar económicamente a su madre quien en estos momentos se encuentra delicada de salud.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase a greater quantity of raw material.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
After success in other activities, Yolanda finally settled on the business of the rental and sale of colorful traditional skirts as her principal means of income. She started the business with little prospects for success, due to the fact that at that time her family was going through difficult financial times. Currently, she has the satisfaction of seeing the progress of her business and she is living proof that with willpower, sacrifice and perseverance things can improve. Yolanda acquires her colorful skirts from the city of La Paz, Bolivia, and in many cases she makes them herself. After finishing the last details of her garments, she exhibits them in her busy locale. She wishes to obtain a loan to purchase more raw materials (fabric) to continue making her skirts. With your generosity, she will be able to make her dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luego de tentar suerte con muchas otras actividades finalmente Yolanda, encontró en el negocio de alquiler y venta de polleras su principal ingreso económico. Ella inició este negocio con pocas oportunidades de prosperar porque en ese entonces su familia atravesaba por difíciles momentos económicos.Actualmente tiene la satisfacción de observar el progreso de su negocio y es la prueba palpante de que con voluntad, sacrificio y perseverancia las cosas pueden mejorar, Doña Yolanda adquiere sus coloridas polleras de la ciudad de la Paz – Bolivia y en muchos casos son confeccionadas por ella misma, luego de concluir con los últimos detalles de sus prendas las exhibe en su concurrido local.Desea obtener un préstamo para adquirir materia prima (tela) para seguir confeccionando agraciadas polleras y centros.Con tu generoso y desinteresado corazón cristalizará su propósito.

loans.use: Capital to purchase a larger quantity of raw material.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia started her business in order to help her husbandwith the school payments for their daughters, now that the oldest is about to leave for preparatory school, the other is in secondary school and the youngest attends primary school. She began making and selling tamales with friends and neighbors. Then they recommended her to the schools for their events, and in this way she has been able to get ahead.

She requests a loan of $200 , which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy raw materials. With your support she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los pagos de escuela de sus hijas ya que la mayor esta apunto de salir de la prepa y la otra esta en la secundria, mientras que la mas pequeña cursa la primaria. Comenzó haciendo y vendiendo tamales con amistades y vecino, despues ellos la fueron recomendando en las escuelas para los eventos, y asi es como ha podido salir adelante.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US$200 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima, con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy materials for her food business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
At the Santa Bárbara market, in the busy commercial center of the city of Juliaca, we find Virginia happily attending to her kiosk of snacks and sodas. Her post is very popular and visited by the patrons of said market because they find in Virginia and her dear children provide quality attention. Virginia is a mother of two small children who, after finishing school for the day, accompany her in her activities. In addition to the business, this diligent mother dedicates herself to sales out in the field. In a short amount of time, these two activities have become the most important means of sustenance for her home. Virginia and her children’s wish is to receive a loan to invest in expanding the variety of merchandise they sell, with which they are sure they would be able to improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

En el mercado Santa Bárbara, concurrido centro comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos a Virginia atendiendo muy contenta su quiosquito de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, este puestito es muy popular y visitado por las comerciantes de dicho mercado porque encuentran en Virginia y en sus queridos hijos una cálida atención.Virginia es madre de 2 pequeños niños quienes luego de terminar de estudiar la acompañan en su actividad, adicionalmente a este negocio esta diligente madre se dedica a la venta por campañas; estas dos actividades se convirtieron en el sustento más importante de su hogar en poco tiempo.El deseo de virginia y sus queridos hijos es recibir un préstamo para invertirlos en aumentar la variedad y el stock de su mercadería, con el que están seguros mejorarán sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increase of capital to be able to offer a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria started her business because her husband does not have stable work. She decided to take the initiative to sell on her own account to obtain income for the payment of services and maintenance of her 4 children. She began her business 3 years ago, selling cookies and empanadas. Now she makes cakes for festivals, anniversaries and 15th birthday celebrations as well.

She requests a loan of $250, that will be repaid in 3 months, to buy supplies for an event that she has soon. With your support she will move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio ya que su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable y decidio tomar la iniciativa de vender por su cuenta para obtener ingresos para el pago de servicios y manutencion de sus 4 hijos. Comenzó hace mas de 3 años, vendiendo galletas y empanadas, ahora hace pasteles para fiestas, bodas y XV años ademas de pays.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima para un evento que tiene proximamente. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy baking supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata and her hardworking husband come from the district of Orurillo-Melgar, a humble little town with few work opportunities. Since deciding to relocate to the city of Juliaca, they have tried at every opportunity to proviD. the best possible quality of life for their four dear children. Fortunata, despite lack of experience, decided to dedicate herself to selling food as a traveling saleswoman. She started by selling traditional dishes from her town but, little by little, she began improving her seasonings and varying her offerings. Meanwhile, her husband Jorge worked for security, but in his spare time he assists his wife with her business activities. Fortunata’s wish is to purchase kitchen utensils and expand her business, and with this investment she will improve her image.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fortunata y su laborioso esposo son naturales del distrito D. Orurillo- Melgar, pueblito humilD. con pocas oportunidades D. trabajo. DesD. que decidieron emigrar hacia la ciudad D. Juliaca tratan en todo momento poner lo mejor D. sí para ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus 4 queridos hijos.Doña Fortunata pese a la poca experiencia y cualidades que tenía para la cocina decidió dedicarse a la venta D. comida en forma ambulatoria. Inició vendiendo platos típicos D. su pueblito, pero poco a poco fue mejorando su sazón y variando sus potajes, mientras que su querido esposo Jorge trabaja como seguridad pero en sus horas libres no duda en colaborar con la actividad D. su amada esposa. El deseo D. Doña Fortunata es adquirir utensilios D. cocina e implementar su negocio, con esta inversión mejorará su imagen.

loans.use: Purchase of utensils and improving her place of sales.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina started the business because of economic need when she was widowed and did not have the pension that she needed for her 6 children. She began 2 years ago selling cosmetics, initially her relatives supported her with her merchandise and in this way she was able to start her business.

She requests a loan of $200 that will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and to be able to supply some pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina inició el negocio por la necesidad economica, cuando enviudo, como no tenia pension necesitaba ingresos para sus 6 hijos. Comenzó hace mas de 2 años con la venta de cosmeticos, inicialmente sus familiares la apoyaron con mercancia y asi pudo iniciar su negocio.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y poder surtir algunos pedidos pendientes.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Comunicadoras Maya Group

texts.es:
In the remote town of Pujujuil 1, hamlet of el Progresso live the ladies that belong to the Comunicadoras Mayan communal bank. El Progresso is a town that is located in a very remote area in the mountains of the region of Solola. The ladies have to walk an hour and a half to arrive at the first location of "pick ups", the main method of public transportation of this region.

Sadly, this town was violently affected during the civil war. Nevertheless, little by little non-governmental organizations and governmental institutions have begun to help this group of people to develop and to increase their standards of living through different types of assistance.

Comunicadoras Mayan is a formidable group. They have two loans with the institution and they have never been late with their payments. It is incredible that people who live in a so remote an area and with so few opportunities for work have such an excellent credit record.

The majority of the group works in the textile sector. Many are weavers. They weave the traditional suits using the waist loom technique. Other ladies work in the breeding of animals. They raise chickens and hogs. Some ladies have two businesses. For example Ramos X. weaves traditional clothes and makes jeweled necklaces.

When it was asked of them if they faced competition, they responded yes. However they noted that, due to working a long time in the business, they already have specific buyers to whom they sell.

The ladies think that the loans have helped them a lot, because this has been the only infusion of capital that they have received in their life. Some say that without this loan their business would never have been able to do well.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En el remoto pueblo de Pujujuil 1, caserio el Progreso habitan las señoras que pertenecen al banco comunal Comunicadoras Mayas. El Progreso es un pueblo que queda en un área muy retirada en las montañas del departamento de Solola. Las señoras tienen que caminar una hora y media para llegar al primer paradero de “pick ups”, el método principal de transporte público de esta región.

Lamentablemente, este pueblo fue violentamente afectado durante la guerra civil. Sin embargo, poco a poco ONGs e instituciones gubernamentales han empezado a ayudar a este grupo de gente a desarrollar e incrementar sus niveles de vida por medio de distintos tipos de asistencia.

Comunicadoras Mayas es un grupo formidable. Ellas llevan dos préstamos con la institución y nunca se han atrasado con sus pagos. Es increíble como gente que vive en un área tan remota y con tan pocas oportunidades de trabajo tenga un record crediticio tan excelente.

La mayoría del grupo trabaja en el sector textil. Muchas son tejedoras. Ellas tejen los trajes tradicionales utilizando la técnica de telar de cintura. Otras señoras trabajan en la crianza de animales. Ellas crían pollos y cerdos. Algunas señoras tienen dos negocios. Por ejemplo Ramos X. teje ropa tradicional y elabora joyas a base de mostacilla.

Cuando se les preguntó a las señoras si ellas percibían la competencia. Ellas respondieron que si, sin embargo ellas especificaron que debido a que llevan mucho tiempo en el negocio, ellas ya tienen compradores específicos a quien venderles.

Las señoras piensan que el crédito las ha ayudado mucho porque este ha sido la única infusión de capital que ellas han recibido durante su vida. Algunas dicen que sin este préstamo sus negocios nunca hubieran podido salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy thread for weaving and embroidering traditional clothing and also to buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Martiniana

texts.es:
Martiniana started her business because of the necessity of paying the household expenses, the maintenance of her 2 children and invoices for services and school. She always worked as a demonstrator, but decided to start her own business 10 years ago. She started as a salesperson, as someone who facilitates sales, and decided to work full-time in cosmetic sales.

She needs a loan of $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your support she will be able to continue prospering.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Martiniana inició el negocio por la necesidad de pagar los gastos de la casa, la manutencio de sus 2 hijos, recibos de servicios y escuela; ella siempre trabajo como demostradora, pero decidio comenzar su negocio hace 10 años empezo como vendedora, como se le facilitaban las ventas, decidio entrar de lleno a la venta de cosmeticos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu apoyo ella podra seguir prosperando.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Gabina Alicia

texts.es:
Gabina, is a single mother and is 40 years of age. She is a member of Banco Comunal Lirio.

She has a young daughter who is five years of age. Gabina has a store where she sells groceries, articles books, and presents. In the beginning she only sold small quantity of products like groceries, decorative stuff, and presents. Also Gabina sells food Típica on Saturdays & Sundays.

Gabina needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in buying presents, decorative stuff, rice, sugar, milk, and candy.

Gabina’s dreams are to construct a home of noble material, supply her business more, and for her daughter to have a good future.

This is Gabina's second loan with Kiva. To see her first loan, go to:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27430&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27430&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Gabina es madre soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hija pequeña de 5 años, Gabina es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.

Gabina tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, artículos de librería, regalos. Al inicio solo vendía pocos productos como abarrotes, actualmente ha incrementado sus productos vende regalos, adornos. Además Gabina vende comida Típica los días sábados y domingos.

Gabina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de regalos, figuras recortables, arroz, azúcar, leche y golosinas

Los sueños de Gabina son construir su casa de material noble, surtir más su negocio y que su hija tenga un buen futuro.

loans.use: presents, decorative stuff, rice, sugar, milk, and candy

loans.name: Kateryna Lyta

texts.es:
Kateryna is a member of the Communal Bank Muchuy Huaraqac.

Kateryna is married, is 34 years of age, and with her husband have a carpentry workroom inside their house. She helps her husband in some jobs, like applying varnish among other jobs. She also is in charge of the sales.

Kateryna needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will invest in buying wood.

Kateryna dreams of having a lumber and hardware store with her daughters become professionals and enlarge their business.

This is Kateryna's second loan with Kiva. To see her first loan, go to:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27117&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27117&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Kateryna es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac.

Kateryna es casada, tiene 34 años, Kateryna junto a su esposo tienen un taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa, Kateryna ayuda en algunos trabajos como el laqueado entre otros, hacen diversos trabajos según pedido de personas o instituciones. Kateryna también se encarga de las ventas.

Kateryna necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.

Kateryna sueña con tener una maderera y ferretería grande, sus hijas sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina is a member of the community bank Paloma.

Dina is a friendly 38 year old woman with five children. Dina has a chicharrones (pork shavings) restaurant in a local spot that she rents. It is located downtown in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells food typical of the region, such as chicharrones prepared with pork meat. She also sells beverages. Dina moved locations four months ago to a bigger space and her sales have improved.

Dina needs a loan of 1600 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of pork meat, sodas, and beers.

Dina’s dreams are to improve her business, offer a better education to her children, and construct her home.

This is Dina's second loan with Kiva. To see her first loan, go to:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27769&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27769&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.

Dina es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Dina tiene una Chicharronería en un local alquilado ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, donde vende comida típica de la zona como el chicharrón preparado con carne de cerdo, también vende bebidas. Dina se cambio de local hace 4 meses a un local más grande y sus ventas mejoraron.

Dina necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de cerdo, gaseosas y cerveza.

Los sueños de Dina son mejorar sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y construir su casa.

loans.use: pork meat, sodas, and beer

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon S. is a widow and lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She is currently unemployed and, instead, manages her family household and tries to help her children who all must work. Phon S. has two sons and two daughters. The two sons, pictured with Phon S. in the photo, are both construction workers, while the daughters work as waitresses. Every day, Phon's daughters have to commute a fairly long distance to work. She therefore hopes to receive a loan to be able to buy a motorbike that they could share for the daily commute.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S. is 50 years old. She runs two complementary businesses: pig raising and rice wine making. The reason these businesses are often combined in Cambodia is because the leftover rice mash from making the wine makes excellent pig feed. Therefore, anyone who makes rice wine can also afford to raise pigs cheaply. With her combined businesses, Tuy S. earns US$3 a day. Her husband is a local fisherman who does well for himself fishing in the province's many lakes and rivers. He earns US$5 a day. Tuy S. and her husband have eight children, the oldest of whom got married just recently. Two others are also grown up and currently work at a hotel earning US$120 per month. Tuy S. is asking for a loan, which she would mostly use for her older children's daily commute to the provincial capital for work. Specifically, Tuy S. hopes to buy them a motorbike to make the commute easier and cheaper.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Veng C. is 26 years old and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She sells soft drinks by the roadside from a large cooler earning US$5 a day. Her husband works as a motorbike mechanic and gets a lot of business each day. His income averages about US$8 a day. The young couple has two children who are still too young to attend school. Veng has several business plans for the future. She needs a loan to be able to purchase mechanic tools to help her husband in his business, as well as a plot of land to sell later once prices go up. Veng expects a rise in land prices, since the volume of tourism in the province is growing at an exponential rate.

loans.use: Purchase of mechanic tools and land

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Chek M. is 40 years old and lives as a housewife in the Siem Reap province. Her husband earns income for the family, working as both a farmer and a fisherman. Even with the two jobs, however, he only earns about US$3 a day. Chek M. and her husband have four children who are all still young and live at home. Chek M. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a water buffalo for the family's farm, which will help increase the overall crop yields and the income of the family.

loans.use: Purchase of a water buffalo

loans.name: Amarat 2024-7 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Karala K.. She sells sugar and is requesting a loan to open a distillery. Karala is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a carpenter. She has 3 children, ranging from ages 4 to 20, and her children go to school. Each week, Karala makes approximately 75 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a distillery.

Karala is joined in her small group by Mary K., Falsta J., Edina J., and Jusfiina P.. Mary K. has a business selling bread and wants to buy some property. Falsta J. sells bread and wants a loan to open a bakery. Edina J. sells local brews and wants to open a bar. Jusfiina P. sells beer and is requesting a loan to construct a house.

loans.use: To open a distillery

loans.name: Nyokoron North 2029-10 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Anna K.. She is currently in the business of making tea and is requesting a loan to open a restaurant. Anna is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a minister. She has 3 children ranging from ages 1 to 5, and her children go to school. Each week, Anna makes approximately 100 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car.

Anna is joined in her small group by Alice M., Monica J., Iponde Josphine, and Didilia J.. Alice M. has a business selling bread and wants to buy flour. Monica J. sells local brew and wants a loan to buy firewood. Iponde Josphine operates a business selling clothes and wants to buying a vehicle. Didilia J. sells clothes and is requesting a loan to open a shop.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Ghufron

texts.ru:
Ghufron is 58 years old and works as a minibus driver, providing transportation throughout the city. He has three children; his daughter is married and lives separately with her husband, and his sons live with him. They are married, and each wants to make a contribution to the family budget, but up to now Ghufron K. alone has been shouldering all the expenses. With a large family and only one person working, it is difficult to support the family. He looked to several banks for loans, but he felt the best about Microinvest's good conditions. Once he received a loan, he began renting another minibus to drive and loaned his own minibus to his eldest son. Now, if business is good he hopes to remodel several parts of the minibus to make room for more people so he can make a bit more money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Гуфрону 58 лет, он работает водителем по городу. У него 3 детей, дочь замужем живет отдельно с мужем. Сыновья живут с ним. Они женаты и что бы покормит семью каждый из них хочет внести какой то вклад в семейный бюджет, до сих пор все затраты нес Кодиров Гуфрон. Теперь, когда его семья очень большая, работая только один такую большую семью будет трудно прокормить. Он обращался в несколько банки, но хорошие условия Микроинвест были ему по душе. Получив кредит, арендуют еще один микроавтобус для транспортировки людей, а свой микроавтобус он одолжил старшему сыну. Надеясь на хороший бизнес, в дальнейшем он переоборудует машину еще на несколько мест, для того чтобы помещалось по больше людей, что позволит заработать немного больше денег.

loans.use: Vehicle remodeling

loans.name: Hai Seminary Marikolong 2044-6 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Fibi K.. She sells posho (a cornmeal based starch) and beans, and is requesting a loan to open a shop. Fibi is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging from ages 6 to 16, and her children go to school. Each week, Fibi makes approximately 100 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

Fibi is joined in her small group by Makala O., Baronica K., Voulate E., and Lona J.. Makala O. sells bread and wants to buy an oven. Baronica K. sells vegetable and wants a loan to pay school fees. Voulate E. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Lona J. sells bread and is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Qurbonaly

texts.ru:
Qurbonaly T. lives in the town of Nurek with his family. He is forty years old, married, and has four children. He's been in the business of selling construction materials for the last five years. He would like to increase sales turnover by taking out a loan. This will help the business grow. He will be able to repay the loan within six months. Despite many difficulties, Qurbonaly has a very close, supportive family. Everyone helps each other joyfully.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer.

Ташрипов Курбонали житель города Нурек. Проживает вместе со своей семьей. Возраст 40 лет . Женат и имеет 4 детей. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей стройматериалов. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет развитию бизнеса. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев. Не смотря на все трудности у Курбонали очень дружная и веселая семья. Они все помогают друг другу с радостью.

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Ibrohim.

texts.ru:
Ibrohim S. lives with his family in Yavan. He is married but does not have any children. He's in sales, selling building materials. He has been in this business for the last eight years. The shop where he works needs to be renovated, and so the client wants to take out a loan. The renovation will allow him to create a better environment for attracting clients as well as for storing goods. The client will be able to repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

Сатторов Иброхим житель города Яван. Проживает вместе со своей семьей. Он женат но детей не имеет. Занимается торговлей стройматериалов. Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже восемь лет.Магазин в котором он работает нуждается в ремонте. Для этого клиент хочет получить кредит . Ремонт помещения поможет ему создать новые условия для клиентов , а так же для хранения товара. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Renovation of workspace

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Suhrob R. lives in the town of Yavan with his family. He is married and has six children. But in order to be able to provide for his family, he has to work in animal breeding. He has a small farm where he breeds great cattle. Currently, he wants to add another room to the barn in order to create more space in the cowshed. This is why he's planned to take out a loan which he'll be able to repay within six months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Раджабов Сухроб пароживает в городе Яван. Живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Работает водителем .Но для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семьюему приходится заниматься животноводством.Он имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. В данный момент хочет пристроит еще одну комнату в сарае для того чтобы увеличить прострнство в коровнике. Для этого он запланировал получить кредит , который сможет погасить в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Enlarge a barn.

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru:
Shamsiddin M. lives in the Shahrinai region, and owns a car that he uses to drive people around. In other words, he is a private taxi driver. He's been a taxi driver for ten years. He has five children, and therefore, in order to support his family, he must work long hours. Recently he had a problem with the car, and in order to fix it, he needs $450 USD. This is the reason why he turned to us for help. Once he receives the loan, he will be able to get major repairs done on the car in order to be able to work without interruptions. He will repay the loan in full within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Манонов Шамсиддин житель района Шахринай. Имеет автомобиль, который использует для перевозки людей. То есть занимается частным такси. Работает уже 10 лет. У него 5 детей , поэтому для толго , чтобы обеспечить семью необходимо много работать. Недавно произошла поломка , которую необходимо отремонтировать, но для этого нужно 450 долларов США . Поэтому Шамсиддин обратился к нам за помощью. Получив кредит он сможет сделать капитальный ремонт автомобиля и обеспечить себя бесперебойной работой. Погасить кредит он сможет в течениии 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Car repair.

loans.name: Charity Mbabazi's Group

texts.en:
Charity is the leader of a 4-member group. She is a 37-year-old widow with 3 children, aged 15, 12 and 8. All the children are in school.

The community she resides and works in is semi-urban. She has been running a Take Away and selling mainly chips and cold drinks in Nakawa for 10 years and a pub in Luzira for 3 years. These are suburbs outside of Kampala.

Some of the challenges she faces are the unstable prices of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, packing materials, and other items that she uses for her business. The variability of the prices greatly affect the market. Her achievements include managing looking after her family single handedly and greatly improving her standard of living.

To supplement her income, she plans to start keeping poultry. Charity is requesting a loan to purchase the poultry. Charity has successfully paid back 9 loans.

loans.use: She plans to start keeping poultry.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima K. lives in a region called Shakhrinau. She lives with her family. She is married and has 3 children. To support her family, she must work very much. She sells goods in the market in Tursan-zoda. She sells potatoes and other kinds of vegetables. She needs money to increase her sales volume. Therefore, Halima plans to take out a loan for 450 US dollars. She will pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Кенджаева Халима жительница района Шахринау. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Для того , чтобы прокормить семью ей приходится много работать . Она занимается торговлей на рынке города Турсун-заде. Продает картофекль и другие виды овощей. Ей нужны деньги для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Поэтому Халима запланировала получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume.

loans.name: Grace Namuddu's Group

texts.en:
Grace is a leader of a 5-member group. She is 30 years old and married with 5 children. They are 14, 12, 10, 8 and 1 years old. The four oldest are in school.

The community she resides and works in is rural. She has been providing these beauty salon services for 10 years in Lusaze, one of the suburbs of Kampala. Her challenges include high rental fees and having to extend services on credit, especially to village mates. Another challenge is the seasonality of the services she provides.

She can now contribute adequately to the running of the home. She is requesting a loan to stock more hair supplies and purchase a hair dryer to increase profits. She would like to save money to buy a piece of land and construct a house. Grace has successfully paid back 5 loans.

loans.use: To stock more hair oils and Vaseline and buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar N. lives with her large family in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is married with 3 children. She has been in the retail business for 3 years selling children's clothing. She wants to take out a loan to be able to sell a larger assortment of clothing. This will help broaden her business and improve the financial situation in the family. In addition, the population, which buys her clothing, will have a larger assortment to choose from. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Нарзикулова Дильбар проживает со своей большой семьей в городе турсун-заде. Замужем и имеет 3 детей. Занимается торговлей уже около 3 лет. Торгует одеждой для детей. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы завести новый ассортимент товара. Это поможет развитию ее бизнеса , а также наладит финансовое положение семьи.Кроме того население , которое пользуется ее услугами сможет приобретать необходимый для них товар и иметь большой выбор в ассортименте. Погасить кредит Дильбар сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase Cash-flow

loans.name: Halovat

texts.ru:
Halovat N. sells men's clothing at the local market in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children. She wants to increase her cash-flow to raise her income. This will help her broaden her business and improve her and her family's lifestyle. To do this, she needs a loan for $450 and plans to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Ниязова Халоват бизнесмен. Занимается тороговлей на рынке города Турсун-Заде. Торгует мужской одеждой. Занимается бизнесом уже три года. Ей 43 года , она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , для того , чтобы получать дополнительный доход. Это поможет расширить бизнес,а так же улучшить условия жизни для себя и своих детей.Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США ,погасить который сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase Cash-flow

loans.name: Prossy Kalungi’S Group

texts.en:
Prossy K. is a 48-year-old married mother of 5 children, ranging in age from 26 to 7. She runs a school canteen at Bugolo Junior School, ½ km away from where she lives in Lugala, a rural district of Kampala. She makes items such as samosas, half-cakes (a kind of fried dough), and pancakes (small patties like banana bread) to sell to the pupils. She has operated the canteen for the past 15 years and found it to be a profitable business. Before that, she was a teacher, but the pay was too low to pay school fees for her children, food and other expenses.

With a loan, she would like to add lined exercise books, pencils and other stationery items to her canteen. If she makes enough profit, she would like to get a small shop for herself rather than at school. At school, she explains, if you retire, someone else takes over the business. Her long-range plan is to build a house in the village so that if she retires, she will have somewhere to stay. She has paid back more than 5 loans

loans.use: Add more items to sell in the canteen

loans.name: Gulbon

texts.ru:
Gulbon O. is a private businesswoman. She works at a local market in Tursun-Zoda selling women's shoes. She has been doing these types of things for 3 years. She plans on increasing her cash flow by investing more money. That is the reason she came to us for a loan. This will increase her combined family income, and at the same time, increase the range of items she sells at the market. She plans on repaying the loan within 12 months. Gulbon lives with her husband and 3 children.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Орипова Гулбон частный предприниматель. Работает на рынке города Турсун-Заде. Торгует женской обувью.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Планирует увеличить товарооборот путем вливания новых средств. А деньги хочет получить в кредит , поэтому обратилась к нам. Это поможет улучшить семейный бюджет, а так же поможет увеличить выбор в ассортименте товара для населения. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Гулбон живет со свое семьей. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей

loans.use: Increase cash-flow

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.ru:
Bibigul Quamova lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda and is married with 1 child. She has a high school education. The responsibility of taking care of her family lies with Bibigul because her husband left to work in Russia. She works in the trading business. She sells children's shoes and clothes at the local market. She wants to increase her cash-flow, which will improve the profitability of her business. This is why she came to us for a loan in order to buy more product to sell. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Каюмова Бибигуль живет в городе Турсун-Заде. Замужем и имеет 1 ребенка. Имеет среднее образование. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию, поэтому ответственность по обеспечению семьи лежит на Бибигуль. Занимается она торговлей. Торгует на рынке города детской обувью и одеждой. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , который сможет увеличить прибыльность ее бизнеса. Для этого она обратилась к нам ,чтобы получить кредит и завести новый товар. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase cash-flow

loans.name: Justine Mugide’S Group

texts.en:
Justine M. is a married woman of 28. She used to be a math and science teacher, but the pay was so low, and often late, that she left the profession to open a school canteen. For the past year, she has operated a canteen at a new private primary school of 200 students. She sells lined exercise books, pencils, pens, as well as snacks such as groundnuts, chapattis and bread. She has found this to be a profitable business.

She lives and works in Masanafu, a trading center near the western outskirts of Kampala, and has to travel to the city centre to purchase items for her canteen.

With a loan, Justine will be able to purchase items to sell and pay school fees for her three younger sisters. She plans to open a big shop as well as save money for future purposes. She hopes one day to build her own school. She says that if people can find ways to support her, it will help her business. Justine is repaying her second loan.

loans.use: Purchase more items to sell in the school canteen.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Mrs. Svay V., 55, lives in Beoung Kok, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a widow and has a daughter who is enrolled in high school. Svay V. has been running a business since 2006, selling mosquito nets, blankets, mats, and other household items, earning approximately US$10 a day. She is now asking for a loan to be able to purchase more supplies to expand her store inventory.

loans.use: Expansion of a general store inventory

loans.name: Victoria Nambuusi's Group

texts.en:
Victoria is a leader of a 5-member group. She is 30 years, single with no children. The community she resides in and works in is semi-urban with a slum in the neighbourhood.

She has been operating a salon and selling cosmetics for the last 6 years and there many customers. Her main challenges are the petty thieves that come from the slum, and the high rental charges. She has been able to increase her stock and attend to her needs and bought a plot of land.

She is requesting a loan so she can stock more cosmetics and synthetic hair, and construct a house. Victoria has successfully paid back more than 10 loans.

loans.use: To stock more cosmetics and synthetic hair

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
Nigora S. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has been working in the trading business for two years and has her own small shop in the local market. Her husband brings in shoes to sell from the city of Dushanbe. Selling these shoes is her family's only source of income. In order to improve her family's lives, and also supply goods to the population, Nigora needs to increase her cash-flow. She needs a loan to be able to do this and will be able to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипова Нигора проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 39 лет , замужем и имеет 5 детей. Два года занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Продает обувь, которую привозит из города Душанбе. Товар привозит ее муж. Поэтому их бизнес это единственный источник дохода их семьи. Для того , чтобы улучшить условия жизни , а так же помочь населению с обеспечением необходимых товаров Нигоре необходимо увеличить товароборот. А для этого она должна получить кредит . Погашать сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase Cash-flow

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo S. M., 42, owns a grocery store in front of her house, where she sells food and various household products to the people in her community, making on average US$20 per day. She is a widow and has four children, two of whom are employed at a factory, while the other two are enrolled in school. In order to meet the booming customer demand, Keo S. M. is asking for a loan to expand her grocery inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products to expand inventory of a store

loans.name: Agnes Luwaga's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a leader of a group with 4 members. She is 45 years, single, with 5 children between the ages of 3 and 20 years. Three of them are still in school. The community she resides in and works in is semi-urban, within a slum and a wetland. The area is prone to flooding in the rainy season.

She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last 15 years, which she purchases in bales to sell at wholesale and retail. She has a stall where she displays the clothes. Sometimes she looks for clothes to purchase in the weekly markets that occur on different days. Other times, Agnes goes from door-to-door in order to sell her clothes.

Her main challenges include high transport costs; the flooded areas, which make clients` homes inaccessible; and losses due to substandard and damaged clothes that she sometimes finds in the bales of clothes.

She has been able to increase her stock and meet the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase more clothes to sell. Her long-range plans are to construct a house. Agnes has successfully paid back more than 4 loans.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothes to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gaur.

texts.ru:
Gaur R. lives in Varzob. He is 43 years old, married, with 4 children. He has a post-secondary education, is a teacher by training. He teaches in a middle school. Gaur also breeds animals, since a teacher's salary is very small. The client buys calf-bulls at the local market, fattens them up, and sells them at a profit. This enterprise allows him to support his large family. Right now the client wants to buy two young bulls for grazing and fattening up. Which is why he needs money. This is the reason for his decision to take out a loan with a repayment period of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator.

Ризоев Гаюр житель района Варзоб. Возраст 43 года, женат , имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности учитель. Клиент работает учителем в средней школе. Так же Гаюр занимаетмя животноводством. Так как заработная плата у учителей очень маленькая .Клиент покупает на рынке молодых бычков откармливает их и продает на рынке по выгодной ему цене. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ему содержать его большую семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить двух бычков для откормки. Для чего ему нужны деньги. Поэтому Гаюр решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of two calf-bulls.

loans.name: Margaret Nantege’S Group

texts.en:
M. Nantege is a 39-year-old single mother of three children, age 15, 13, and 10. She has been a member of MCDT for about 5 years and has received 11 loans from them in the past. Her business is making envelopes.

Each week, M. buys kilos of paper to fold into envelopes that she sells to photography studios in Kampala town. Five days a week, she makes the envelopes in her home, starting at 8 in the morning and sometimes finishing at midnight. Making the envelopes is a lot of work, she says. “You sit and sit and the back bone pains you.” Once she has folded the envelopes, she collects them into bundles of 50. One day each week she goes to the photography studios on Wilson Road to sell them, selling about 100 bundles each week. She has been doing this for about 8 years.

With the money from the loan, she will buy paper and glue for the envelopes, as well as be able to pay school fees, buy food and books, and look after her mother.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make envelopes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en:
Gunay lives in the town of Khachmaz. She is 26, married and has one child.

She is requesting a loan of $975 to purchase the supplies needed for her barber shop. She has owned this business for two years.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary supplies for a barber shop.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum S., 56, is a widow and works as a vegetable vendor at the Phsar Sang Ke market, which is about 6 kilometers away from the centre of Phnom Penh. With this business, she can typically earn around US$10 per day. Her married daughter (pictured in the photo) works as a cook and rents out a part of her house to people from other families. Sometimes, her daugher also assists in selling vegetables at the market, only 40% of which she then keeps to herself. 
Mrs. Prum S. currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to repair a part of her daughter's rental house to attract more tenants.

loans.use: Repair of a house for business purposes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase jeans to sell.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin was born in 1962 in the town of Khachmaz. He is married and has two children.

Elchin has five years of experience in the house repair business. He is requesting a loan of $975 to buy the necessary materials to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary materials to improve business

loans.name: Said Nassor's Kasi Mpya Group

texts.en:
Said N., age 50, is married with 4 children (ages 23, 21, 19 and 7). He buys and sells cattle in the business he started in1998. He works from 7am to 3pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $208.

In the past Said has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his working capital. He hopes for a new loan to buy more cattle for sale.

Said will share this loan with his five subgroup members, who have shops, a nursery school, and businesses selling clothes and chickens.

loans.use: to buy and sell more cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one PlayStation, two televisions, and five chairs.

loans.name: Seyfaddin

texts.en:
Seyfaddin was born in 1964 in the Khachmaz region. He is married and has two children.

Six years ago, Seyfaddin started his business.He is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase a calf and balling presses to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a calf and balling presses

loans.name: Clémence

texts.fr:
A native of DANGBO in the department of Ouémé in the Republic of Benin, Mrs. Clémence B. was born on 30 March 1977 in Hozin. For the past 7 years, she has been selling basic need goods, including charcoal, rice, spaghetti, maize, tomatoes, drinks, and so on. She obtains her supplies in her village, and sometimes in Cotonou for certain urgent needs. Mrs. Clémence B. is married and has 4 children. She is asking for this loan for a refrigerator enabling her to sell drinks and ice cubes, and also for the purchase of bags of charcoal to strengthen her business in the future. She has a highly diverse clientele, due to her longstanding presence in the area.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Originaire de DANGBO dans le département de l'Ouémé en République du Bénin, dame B. Clémence est née le 30 Mars 1977 à Hozin. Elle vend depuis 7 ans certains produits de première nécessité à savoir charbon de bois, riz, spaghetti, maïs, tomate, boisson et autres. Elle s'approvisionne dans son village et quelque fois à Cotonou pour certains besoins urgents. Dame B. Clémence est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir un réfrigérateur afin de pouvoir vendre des boissons, des glaçons et aussi pour acheter des sacs de charbons pour renforcer d'avantage son commerce. Elle dispose d'une clientèle assez variée compte tenu de son ancienneté dans le quartier.

loans.use: To buy 2 baskets of tomatoes, 10 bags of charcoal, and to buy a second-hand refrigerator

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda (her husband is pictured) has been in the farming business for five years in the Khachmaz region where she lives with her husband and two children. She was born in 1980.

The family needs a loan of $750 to buy fruit seedlings and fertilizer for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy fruits seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Imam

texts.en:
Imam is 51-years-old, lives in the town of Khachmaz with his wife and two children.

He has repaired houses for five years and is requesting a loan of $975 to purchase the necessary materials for improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase home repair materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Akbar Kushkarob lives in the region of Rudaki. He is 27 years old, married, with one child. He has a secondary education. The client works in a baking factory. Akbar also breeds sheep and goats. He buys young sheep at the market, feeds them to fatten them up, then sells them at the market for a sufficient profit. This kind of enterprise brings him additional income. At the moment, the client wishes to purchase several lambs and send them out to graze. This is why he needs money. Akbar has decided to take out a loan with a repayment period of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer.

Кушкаров Акбар житель района Рудаки. Возраст 27 лет , женат , имеет 1 ребенка . Образование средние. Клиент работает в лепешечном цехе. Так же Акбар занимается разведением мелкого рогатого скота. Он покупает на рынке молодых овец , откармливает их и перепродает на рынке по выгодной ему цене. Этот вид деятельности приносит ему дополнительный доход . В данный момент клиент хочет купить ягнят и отправить их на пастбище. Поэтому ему нужны деньги. Акбар решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of sheep.

loans.name: Jennifer Kemigisha`s Group

texts.en:
Jennifer is the leader of the group of five members who have stayed together since they joined MCDT. They are repaying their fourth loan. She is 30 years of age and a widow who has just lost her husband through an accident. He left her with 2 biological children 8 and 4 years old, and his own 16-year-old daughter. She left school due to pregnancy. Both of her children attend in school. Jennifer never had any loans until she joined MCDT. The community she lives in is urban within a slum in a low-lying area.

Jennifer has a retail shop and sells essential items and cold drinks. She acquired a refrigerator and a television set to attract more clients. She has many customers.

The main challenge is the flooded surroundings during the rainy season. The benefits of having her retail shop include being able to take her children to school, increased working capital, and providing for her family.

With a loan, Jennifer plans to acquire a public pay telephone. Her daughter will operate the phone, and this will increase their income. She also plans to build a house on the plot of land that her late husband left.

loans.use: Plans to acquire a public pay telephone

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.ru:
Nematullo K. lives in the region of Rudaki. He is 30 years old, married, and has three children. He has a secondary, technical education. He works as a taxi driver, using his own car. He has over three years experience in this field. He is the sole breadwinner in his large family. At the moment the client's car is in need of immediate repair. But he has no money for it. This is why the client turned to our organization, and asked for a loan. Nematullo plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Кушкаров Неъматулло житель района Рудаки.Возраст 30 лет , женат , имеет 3 детей. Образование средне-техническое. Работает таксистом на собственной машине. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 3 лет . Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода его большой семьи.В момент клиент его машине нужен срочный ремонт.А денег на это у него нет .Поэтому клиент обратился в нашу организацию за кредитом. Неъматулло планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Raïmatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1970 in Porto Novo, the political capital of Bénin, Mrs. Raïmatou G. is married to a health worker and is the mother of four children, two of whom she still looks after, the other two being married. As a result of her 15 years’ experience, Mrs. G. has become the main supplier to local residents. She generally buys her supplies at Cotonou’s Dantokpa market at least once a week. She is requesting this loan to set up as a wholesaler in order to make her business more profitable.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1970 à Porto Novo la capitale politique du Bénin, dame G. Raïmatou est mariée à un agent de santé et est mère de 04 enfants dont 02 sont encore à sa charge, les 02 autres s'étant déjà marié. Du haut de ses quinze années d'expérience dame G. Raïmatou est devenue la principale fournisseur des habitants de son quartier. Elle s'approvisionne généralement au marché DANTOKPA de Cotonou au moins une fois dans la semaine. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour se lancer dans la vente en gros afin de rentabiliser son commerce.

loans.use: To buy 20 trays of fresh eggs, 50 liters of vegetable oil, 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 5 baskets of onions.

loans.name: Zulfiya.

texts.ru:
Zulfiya H. lives in Rudaki. She is 20 years old, married. She has a secondary education. For the last three years Zulfiya has been baking pies at home. She sells them at the local market, where she has a permanent client base. She selling her pies at a reduced price. The client lives with her elderly parents, and is the sole breadwinner for the family. Zulfiya needs an electric oven to make her baked goods. This is why she decided to take out a loan. She plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator.

Хатамова Зульфия жительница района Рудаки. Возраст 20 лет, замужем.Образовагние среднее.Зульфия вот уже 3 года занимается выпечкой пирожков у себя дома. Реялизует свою продукцию на местном рынке, где имеет постоянных клиентов. Так как Зульфия продает свою продукцию намного дешевле других.Клиентка живет с престарелыми родителями и является единственной кормилицей в семье. Зульфия нужна элнктро-духовка для выпечки хлебо-булочных изделий. Для чего она решила взять кредит . Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of an oven

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
Coming from a modest family, Mrs. Aminatou B. hails from Sakété, a small city situated in the southeast of Benin in the department of Plateau. She has in her care 2 children; her husband lives in Gabon. Very early on, she began engaging in business in her hometown. After that, she established herself in Cotonou in the DANTOKPA market, where she sold tablets. The sale of medicine being banned, she abandoned this business. Currently, she has found a site to sell various products as well as fruit juice and lollipops. She is on her fourth loan, and has handled herself very well. This loan will allow her to restock her store. It is important to note that she often benefits from the support of her elder daughter in transporting certain products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Issue d'une modeste famille dame B. Aminatou est originaire de Sakété une petite ville située au Sud-est du Bénin dans le département du Plateau. Elle a à sa charge 02 enfants; son mari résident au Gabon. Très tôt elle s'est lancée dans le commerce dans sa ville natale. Ensuite, elle s'est installée à Cotonou dans le marché DANTOKPA où elle vendait des comprimés. La vente de médicaments étant une activité proscrite, elle a abandonné cette activité. Aujourd'hui, elle a trouvé un emplacement où elle vend divers produits et également des jus de fruits et sucette. Elle est à son quatrième crédit et se comporte très bien. Ce prêt lui servira donc à ravitailler sa boutique. Notons qu'elle bénéficie souvent de l'appui de sa fille aînée pour l'écoulement de certains produits.

loans.use: To buy 2 cartons of condensed milk, 5 cartons of soap, sugar, and food colouring to make lollipops, and milk to make yogurt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a small business selling beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase stock to make more food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a small business selling natural medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add new dental care products and other goods to her inventory.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 46 year old widow and mother of five children. She lives in Sagam Siaya, Kenya. Her husband died in 2006 due to an HIV-related illness. She has supported her family single-handedly by selling ready-made clothes. She started her business in 2007 after her husband's death. She is also a member of an HIV/AIDS support group in Siaya. She requires $500.00 to increase her stock of ready-made clothes.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of ready-made clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase natural medicines for her small business.

loans.name: Christine Kikoyo’S Group

texts.en:
Christine K. is 27 years old, married, with six children, ranging in age from 4 to 14. The five oldest are all in school.

Christine has operated a profitable grocery business for the past 7 years, selling matooke (green bananas), sweet potatoes, tomatoes, greens, fish and fruits in the market at Masanafu, a rural district of Kampala. She buys items from the Kasubi market, where farmers transport and sell their produce at relatively low prices. In turn, she sells the produce to her neighbours and the people in her community. She started her grocery because she needed money for school fees for her children.

With a loan, she will add new items to her business, such as charcoal. By selling more things and different things, her business will be even more profitable. She has successfully paid back more than 5 loans.

Christine would like to achieve a high standard of living: buying clothes for the children and having a good house. She wants to have enough money for all her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: Add new items to sell in the market

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in natural medicines to move her business forward.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Seynabou N. engages in the sale of peanuts, millets, palm oil, peanut paste, and maize. She has already repaid her first loan of 100,000 F CFA. She is asking for this loan of 200,000 F to strengthen her business. She has no problems selling her goods. She is the mother of a family, and is very dynamic and hard-working.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Seynabou N. s'active dans la vente d'arachide, de mil, d'huile de palme, de pate d'arachide et de mais. Elle a déjà payé un premier crédit de 100 000 F CFA. elle sollicite ce crédit de 200 000 F pour renforcer son commerce. Elle n'a pas de probleme pour la vente de ses produits. C'est une mere de famille tres dynamique et travailleuse.

loans.use: Transportation costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bulk-buy women's clothing to restock her business.

loans.name: Nereah

texts.en:
Nereah A. is a 45 year old entrepreneur and mother of four living children. She is pictured above (after being involved in an accident). She and her husband live in Siaya, Kenya. She began her current business selling second-hand clothes eight years ago. She specializes in both children's and women’s clothing.
